programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Black Lion in Halland, East Sussex, where host Nigel Fright gets off to a shaky start when a kettle goes missing from one of the rooms. Later, he takes the guests to a salsa class, where Sherrill Tacy and Hayley Cotton are surprised by some of his dance moves.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: John and Della Baines ask Jasmine Harman to help them find the perfect holiday home on Cyprus. With a budget of £45,000, she shows them five apartments around the town of Paphos.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin offer advice to Alix Sinclare, who cannot decide whether to start a new life in Teignmouth in Devon or Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The owner of London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield has to deal with a bus-load of antiques and a watch once owned by Saddam Hussein. Meanwhile, 200 miles away at Pickwicks in London, Nathan and Debbs value an impressive collection of jewels and watches, a set of antique coins and a pair of luxury designer handbags.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp meets newlyweds Graeme and Anna, who have relocated from Oxfordshire to Yorkshire only to find their hopes of buying a big, spacious property in a rural location thwarted by a rising market. Phil Spencer helps local couple Sammi and Tom locate their perfect property on a budget of £180,000 in a specific three-mile radius north of Leeds.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp meets thrill-seeker Davy, who likes snowboarding and skateboarding, and wants a property in west London, while Phil Spencer is in the north of the city helping Rajeev and Nisha find their dream family home after renting for five years. However, despite a generous £500,000 budget, the couple discover they can't have everything they want.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Adam Reed hosts the first party in Southend-on-Sea, Essex, confident his eclectic menu incorporating dishes from three continents, as well as plans to round off the evening Mexican-style with a shot of tequila, will be a success. His fellow diners are ageing hippie Andie Todd, ladies' man Scott Cooper, outspoken hairdresser Colin Vidgeon and lively former policewoman Kerry Tolliday.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Andie Todd hosts the second party in Southend-on-Sea, Essex, providing a menu of 1970s-inspired food. However, her starter of chicken-liver pate fails to live up to expectations, and reduces her chances of claiming the £1,000 prize on offer.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Colin Vidgeon hosts the third dinner-party challenge in Southend-on-Sea. He hopes to impress his guests with a menu of toad in the hole and garlic-baked prawns, but cooking blunders and makeshift decorations seriously hamper his chances.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former policewoman Kerry Tolliday hosts the penultimate dinner party in Southend-on-Sea and provides a menu that places the emphasis on flavours. She also hires a psychic medium for the entertainment, but encounters scepticism from her guests during a ghost hunt.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Butcher Scott Cooper throws the final dinner party in Southend-on-Sea, Essex, and hopes to impress with a menu featuring duck, pork belly and black pudding. However, the evening turns sour when Andie Todd confronts the host about his sexist behaviour and crude jokes, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesake's magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef continues his quest to transform the fortunes of the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions were running high because owner Alan Saffron had spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. Alan gets a wake-up call from internet critics, who he believes are trying to shut him down.(n)

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke returns to catch up with London couple Justin Hooper and Charlotte Seddon, who first appeared in the show's third series, planning to transform a derelict wartime airfield control tower in Scotland into a new family home. Four years later, George finds out how the pair's ambitious venture fared, as they struggled to project-manage the site from 600 miles away. With costs spiralling out of control, Justin and Charlotte faced a difficult decision: shut down the build, or make a complete lifestyle change by relocating their family to the site.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Property duo Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp take their house-hunting expertise to the West Midlands and Shropshire. Kirstie meets Hannah and John Sherlock, who want to downsize and move into Shrewsbury town centre on a budget of £350,000, while in Wolverhampton, Phil is with professional musicians Me'sha and Darren, who are looking to buy their first home together, close to Me'sha's family.(n)

programme.title: How to Live Mortgage Free with Sarah Beeny
programme.desc: In this episode, Sarah Beeny meets a young couple who built their first home together on the back of an agricultural trailer for only £25,000, a woman from West Yorkshire who converted three derelict garages for just £12,000, and the creator of an affordable three-bed prefab that can be assembled in a week.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, including Bigheads, Britain's Got Talent, Line of Duty, Little Boy Blue, Joanna Lumley's Postcards, The Island with Bear Grylls and the News.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls
programme.desc: With old and young now living side by side, the islanders are hoping to hit their stride, but the lack of food is an ever-pressing concern and tempers are fraying. Jordan is feeling out of sorts and then has a fight with Richie, while the members of the group are furious when Phil uses some olive oil to boost the fire rather than for food. Soon there is another bust up, stretching relations between the participants to breaking point. Could a shocking vote see the islanders turn on one of their own?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Chris Addison taking on Joe Wilkinson and Katherine Ryan. David O'Doherty joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Female Sumatran tiger Kirana faces losing her two sons, who are fully grown and being moved to other zoos to start families of their own. Indonesian dwarf buffalo Oana, one of Chester's most sensitive animals, gives birth - only for the new mum's anxiety to threaten her calf's health. Capuchin monkey Maud's eldest son Rocky is causing problems, refusing to listen to his mother's life lessons, and capybara Lochley has to rely on her mum Lilly to look after her newborn babies when she falls ill.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: The death at the hospital is causing suspicion, meaning troubled teenager Sam must tread carefully and hold his psychopathic desires in check. Meanwhile, as a threat from the past resurfaces, his mum Jenny summons the courage to face her fears. Four-part psychological thriller, starring Romola Garai, Daniel Mays, Richard Coyle, Jack Rowan and Lara Peake.(n)

programme.title: World's Most Expensive Cars
programme.desc: A team tracks down rare cars from around the world for RM Sotheby's. Ant goes to California in search of the most expensive American sports car ever sold at auction.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Wheatsheaf Inn in Exning, near Newmarket, Suffolk, where guests are welcomed by owner Ken Clutterbuck and employee Ginny Trow. The proprietor tries to win his rivals round with his unique sense of humour, but tensions rise when the contestants go for a spin on a go-kart track.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bournemouth couple David and AJ create a menu inspired by South Africa, while fellow contestants Alex and Vinnie and Andrea and Wayne hope their dishes will win them the £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In East Anglia, hip-hop enthusiasts Christine and Terry provide a hearty menu for their guests, before allotment owners Tim and Amanda host with a menu dedicated to their home-grown fruit and veg. Finally, Megan and Matt - who rarely spend time together in the kitchen - set off their fire alarm and have difficulty pulling things together and getting any food to the table.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James enjoys a tipple from an unusual £75,000 fire engine bar, memorabilia expert Lawrence is presented with an autograph collection that could be worth £20,000, and a former model wants to sell some designer bags to the high-end pawnbrokers to finance the renovation of her house and her body.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Property expert Phil Spencer goes house-hunting in Hertfordshire on behalf of newlyweds Carl and Liz, who want to leave London for a new start in St Albans. Can he find them a home with space that is also well-connected for £425,000? Meanwhile, Kirstie Allsopp assists Naomi, who wants a place in Hemel Hempstead with enough room for her pole-dancing equipment.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Property duo Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp take their house-hunting expertise to the West Midlands and Shropshire. Kirstie meets Hannah and John Sherlock, who want to downsize and move into Shrewsbury town centre on a budget of £350,000, while in Wolverhampton, Phil is with professional musicians Me'sha and Darren, who are looking to buy their first home together, close to Me'sha's family.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fashion journalist Robert Johnston hosts the first dinner party in south London, serving Stilton ice-cream and tomato sorbet, slow-roasted pork with chilli and fennel, and Sephardic orange and almond cake.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee aqua-aerobics instructor Jennifer Joseph hosts the second dinner party in south London, preparing a mountain of home-cooked Caribbean food and asking her guests to dress in hoodies and jeans. However, her plans to create a relaxed atmosphere fail when Joe Kempster's incessant chatter begins to annoy the other diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bricklayer Joe Kempster hosts the third dinner party in south London. He prides himself on making all his dishes from scratch and hopes to compensate for past misunderstandings with the other guests by preparing a meal featuring a mystery Greek main course.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hospital technician Karen Hill hosts the penultimate dinner party in south London. She hopes to impress her guests by preparing seven dishes, including Chinese duck, French pate, Greek lamb, Turkish rice and American cheesecake - but the extensive menu causes her problems.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Majid Ravandi hosts the final dinner party in south London, but fails to impress with a hot prawn starter and a dry main course. As the meal progresses, a bickering Joe and Karen threaten to spoil the cook's friendly demeanour, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, New York. The chances of the establishment becoming a success are being ruined by the owner Buddy Mazzio's two sons, bartender Jason and chef Brian, who are constantly fighting with each other, prompting Gordon to have a heart-to-heart with the family.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay heads to Windsor, Vermont, on a mission to boost the fortunes of the Juniper Hill Inn, which may look impressive, but smells of raw sewage owing to a plumbing problem. After meeting the B&B's wealthy owner Robert Dean II, the chef uncovers some shocking treatment toward staff and realises he will need something approaching a miracle to save this business from disaster.(n)

programme.title: How to Live Mortgage Free with Sarah Beeny
programme.desc: In this episode, Sarah Beeny meets a young couple who built their first home together on the back of an agricultural trailer for only £25,000, a woman from West Yorkshire who converted three derelict garages for just £12,000, and the creator of an affordable three-bed prefab that can be assembled in a week.(n)

programme.title: Escape to Costa Rica
programme.desc: Science writer Gaia Vince explores the island, which is the most sustainable nation in the world, home to over 500,000 species of animal and with a national grid run on rivers and volcanoes that is due to be completely carbon neutral by 2021. She meets the republic's president, who explains his environmental policies, and joins a team of scientists helping to preserve the island's forests and wildlife.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Chris Addison taking on Joe Wilkinson and Katherine Ryan. David O'Doherty joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Hoarders
programme.desc: Experts in the field of hoarding disorder spend over three months carefully treating two people who have a persistent difficulty in discarding or parting with possessions - hoping to transform their lives and mend their failing relationships. Sue in Nottinghamshire has hundreds of dolls all around her house, driving her partner Neil to despair, while Scott stores thousands of spare computer and hardware parts piled high in every room of the house he shares with wife Faith, including the bedroom and bathroom.(n)

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: Grimebusters Sandra and Carly travel to the United States, where they tackle the homes of 51-year-old former builder Will, from Gordonsville, Virginia. He has obsessive compulsive personality disorder, which has led to a shopping addiction, causing his apartment to be stuffed with internet purchases. The duo have their work cut out as he also owns a mansion house in the centre of town that's also heaving with junk.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: As the new dance season begins, Abby Lee Miller warns the girls that any mishaps will lead to them being axed from the team and immediately replaced.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: The Hennessys watch Freaky Friday before falling asleep - and wake up to find everyone has swapped bodies with someone else, except Kerry, who enjoys her family's turmoil.(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body

Love unexpectedly blossoms between the grieving man and his spiritualist helper, but his ex-fiancee's ghost is determined to put an abrupt end to their burgeoning relationship. Romantic comedy, starring Eva Longoria, Paul Rudd and Lake Bell.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In this special episode, the High Court enforcement agents have to deal with a fraudulent tenant, an evasive debtor and a mother in denial. Steve and Ben are in west London to see a tenant who owes £14,000 in unpaid rent, but when they gain access to the property they discover the house has divided up like a hotel and is being sublet. In Sussex, Brian and Del chase a debt of over £10,000 owed to a van rental business for damaged vehicles, before heading to Kent to try to reclaim £6,000 of unpaid rent from a woman financially dependent on a new partner after a disastrous divorce.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay Special: Big Family Bust Up.
programme.desc: One-off edition in which the High Court enforcement agents are caught in the crossfire of three bitter family disputes, including a debt-dodging man who pushes his panic-stricken mother over the edge. Plus, a family booted onto the streets at night by a ruthless aunt, and a man who won't engage with the agents and loses his car.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Luke takes an instant shine to Taylor's lawyer, and Lorelai makes a big impression on one of Lane's band members, while Paris and Rory's feud is halted by headmaster Charleston, who threatens to revoke the glowing college references he wrote for them.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Sherry goes into labour and asks Rory to stay with her, prompting Lorelai to reminisce about her own daughter's birth and her teenage romance with Christopher. Elsewhere, Luke and Nicole's first date goes well, while Paris steps up her hate campaign.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments. Brian and Graham have been warned to expect trouble as they evict some tenants from a south London flat, one of whom has a reputation for violence. Everything goes smoothly until the enforcement agents make a shocking discovery in a child's bedroom. Paul and Steve head to Slough to collect wages owed to a freelance worker, but the debtor is less than happy to find the high-court enforcement officers on his doorstep and things get physical.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Brody has advice for both Phoebe and Justin, while Irene realises VJ and Leah are struggling with Luc and makes a generous offer. Olivia and Hunter struggle to find a place to live.(n)

programme.title: World's Worst Tenants
programme.desc: The team goes undercover to protect a property owner from a criminal, and also becomes involved in a heated debate between a landlord and a tenant who has been lighting bonfires in his Jacuzzi. Todd Howard and Rick Moore also investigate a noise complaint and discover their worst nightmare.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart and Iain head to Manchester, where a landlord is owed £8,000 in rent arrears and has already called for police back-up. As tempers rise, the pair must find a way to handle a situation that is spiralling dangerously out of control. Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase £3,000 owed to a firm of letting agents, before tracking a debtor who was accidentally over-paid for a job. Plus, Stewart and Iain face an eviction that is set to test their patience.(n)

programme.title: Badass Brides
programme.desc: A 21-year-old bride plans her fairytale wedding with a £2,000 budget, and 24-year-old Aysha decides to have two weddings - a traditional British one and a traditional Indian one.(n)

programme.title: The Magicians
programme.desc: Julia and Quentin continue their quest to reunite Julia with her shade, and Penny tries to find a way to get into the Poison Room, finding a new ally in his colleague Sylvia.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: Women who claim benefits while looking after several children. They include Chesterfield mum Maria, who has five kids to five different dads and has not worked since 2002. She is so desperate to get off benefits she has signed herself up to the same college course as her daughter. Birmingham woman Karen has six children and a seventh on the way with partner Ashleigh - and although his job search is not going well he keeps himself busy in other ways. In Weymouth, Kate picks up almost £30,000 a year in benefits to supplement her husband Ian's income as a taxi driver - and spends more than £170 a month of this on pocket money for her seven kids.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The 'Coon proves himself to be even more evil than Cthulhu as he punishes his former partners. Meanwhile, Kenny wrestles with the weight of his own super power through his alter-ego, Mysterion.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Randy becomes obsessed with the Food Network, and quits his job to pursue his new passion. However, his decision begins to have an adverse effect on Stan's life, and forces Sharon to explore a new interest of her own.(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: A murderer is loose on the streets of Manhattan. A diabolical killer whose brutal slayings leave a trail of cryptic messages hidden at the scene of the crime. Clues which only a brilliant mind can interpret. Now as the city lies in fear, a gifted but disabled detective is on the case. With the help of a rookie street cop, the two must go inside the mind of this terrifying madman and defeat him at his own game. For he will strike again but next time they may just be too late(n)

programme.title: Village of the Damned
programme.desc: Horror in which two doctors struggle to save the residents of a sleepy Californian village after a band of aliens impregnate ten female villagers in the hope of using their supernatural powers to reign supreme. Based on John Wyndham's novel The Midwich Cuckoos, this is a remake of an earlier 1960s film adaptation(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing faith in Christmas, a young boy accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus and his minions. The fearsome creatures proceed to wreak havoc on him and his dysfunctional family in this yuletide horror comedy based on ancient folklore(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: Mad Max, now a loner, is reluctantly helping a tiny oil-producing community defend itself against band of depraved crazies thirsty for precious fuel(n)

programme.title: Coyote Ugly
programme.desc: An aspiring musician becomes one of the most famous bartenders in New York in this high-spirited comedy-drama. Small-town girl Violet Sanford (Piper Perabo) dreams of making a name for herself as a singer and songwriter, so she moves to New York City in hopes of landing her big break. Needing to support herself until stardom rolls around, she takes a job as a barmaid at a new nightspot called Coyote Ugly, where the owner Lil (Maria Bello) and the staff of attractive young women dance on the bar, flirt with the mostly male clientele, sing along with the jukebox, and goad the customers into matching them shot for shot. Soon, local media pick up on the bar's success, turning the staff into unexpected celebrities, a situation that presents its own set of problems. Coyote Ugly also stars John Goodman as Violet's straight-laced father, Adam Garcia as a customer Violet becomes involved with, and Tyra Banks, Melanie Lynskey, Bridget Moynahan, and Izabella Miko as the barmaids; action-film titan Jerry Bruckheimer produced(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Mooseport
programme.desc: When ex-President Monroe Cole retires to a small town, the locals invite him to run for mayor. Plumber 'Handy' Harrison is planning to run too. Cole persuades Harrison to stand down, but when the statesman starts to romance Handy's girlfriend, the plumber re-enters the race(n)

programme.title: Say Anything...

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: Dramatic tale of a college drop-out who sets off on the road to fortune working in an upmarket Manhattan bar where he teams up with a flashy barman. But their partnership disintegrates when they fall out over a woman(n)

programme.title: Magnolia
programme.desc: Sprawling, powerful, compelling series of intercut tales with a cast of heavyweights including an inspired Tom Cruise. Jason Robards plays Earl Partridge, whose son runs evangelical How To Get Laid seminars. A nurse contacts Cruise and the two come together for an uneasy, cathartic reunion(n)

programme.title: The Conspirator
programme.desc: When Abraham Lincoln is assassinated, Union war hero Frederick Aiken is brought in to defend alleged Confederate conspirator, Mary Surrat(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon

programme.title: Marauders

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage hunts for a legendary treasure that's been hidden for centuries. Unfortunately, villain Sean Bean is after the loot too. Breakneck Bruckheimer adventure(n)

programme.title: Platoon
programme.desc: This drama examines the fight between good and evil among an American infantry platoon in the jungles of Vietnam(n)

programme.title: Rails & Ties
programme.desc: Kevin Bacon, Marcia Gay Harden, and Miles Heizer star in director Alison Eastwood's tale of two families locked into an emotional -- and physical -- collision course. There once was a time when Tom and Megan Stark had all the time in the world to take their dream vacation and start a family, but these days the couple's marriage is suffering and their time appears to be running short. Megan has been diagnosed with a potentially terminal illness, and when the prospect of losing his wife becomes too much to bear, railroad engineer Tom seeks escape in his work. On the tracks Tom is in control; all the routes are predetermined and he knows he'll eventually arrive at his destination. But sometimes even the most predictable events can go suddenly awry, and when Tom's train hits a car that was parked on the tracks by a suicidal mother, his life is plunged into ruin. While there was no way that Tom could have possibly stopped the train on time, the grieving conductor's woes are suddenly compounded upon realizing that he may lose his job because of the accident. Not only that, but the deceased woman's son, Davey, is consumed by the guilt that he could do nothing to prevent the accident, and he now places the blame for his mother's death squarely on Tom. But not all sad stories have to end in tragedy, and perhaps in the aftermath of this fateful accident Megan could receive a second chance at fulfilling her dreams, Tom could learn to open his heart before he is consumed by bitterness, and Davey could finally learn the true meaning of family(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way: Rise to Power

programme.title: Dark Water

The note that catches Sophie's eye is from an English woman, Claire, detailing her lost Italian love. Although the note's been there for decades, Sophie decides to respond, little realising that she's just taken the first step on a romantic journey of her own... programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Hoi Polloi. In one of their best Columbia shorts, The Three Stooges get involved with a professor (Harry Holmes) who wagers that he can transform the nitwits, Pygmalion-like, into refined gentleman. Written by the genial Felix Adler and directed with vim and vigor by the team's usual pilot, del Lord, Hoi Polloi is typical Stooges mayhem. In the supporting cast, Laurel & Hardy veteran Blanche Payson and Jean Harlow's stand-in Mary Dees joined such Stooges regulars as Geneva Mitchell, Phyllis Crane, Grace Goodall and Robert Graves. Hoi Polloi was remade by the Stooges in 1947 as Half Wits Holiday and again in 1958, as Pies and Guys(n)

programme.title: Twister

Bill was a storm chaser too, but left to become a successful weatherman. His change of profession ruined his marriage to Jo. Before separating, the Hardings invented DOROTHY, a gizmo designed to release thousands of tiny sensors when a tornado passes over it(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: Slick crime caper based on the classic Rat Pack film. When thief Danny Ocean is released from prison, he rounds up his old team of top criminals for a complicated heist in which they will rob three Las Vegas casinos at the same time. The casinos are owned by ruthless hotelier Terry Benedict, who is now dating Danny's ex-wife - and who is not so keen to part with his cash(n)

The tearaways are deputised and told to bring the guilty men back alive, but Billy has other plans, and a bloody rampage ensues(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: San Francisco Police Inspector 'Dirty' Harry Callahan and his new partner, Early Smith have been temporarily reassigned from Homicide to Stakeout Duty. Meanwhile, those of the city's criminals who manage to avoid punishment by the courts are nevertheless being killed by unknown assassins. Callahan begins to investigate the murders despite the orders of his superior officer, Lieutenant Briggs. A man has to know his limitations..(n)

programme.title: Black Card
programme.desc: A missing identification card forces a couple to take a closer look at their culture, identity and place in society. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2015 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Children
programme.desc: After a nuclear power plant leaks poison gas, the children on a school bus are transformed into zombies(n)

programme.title: Mirrors
programme.desc: Kiefer Sutherland stars as an NYPD detective-turned-security guard who discovers something sinister lurking in the mirrors of a fire-damaged department store in Haute Tension writer/director Alexandre Aja's menacing study in the origins of evil. It's been just about a year since mercurial police detective Ben Carson (Sutherland) was suspended from the NYPD for the fatal shooting of an undercover officer, and ever since that fateful day he's been locked in a self-destructive spiral of anger and alcoholism. Increasingly isolated from his wife and kids, Ben spends most nights crashed-out at his sister Angela's (Amy Smart) apartment in Queens. But Ben hasn't given up hope just yet, and in order to get his life back together and prove that he's still capable of supporting his family he takes a job as the night watchman at the Mayflower department store. The Mayflower used to be a lavish symbol of inner-city prosperity, that is, until a raging inferno gutted the building while claiming numerous lives in the process. These days, the Mayflower is a scorched reminder of human misery, the ornate mirrors therein reflecting a suffering so profound that it begins to wear on Ben's already-fragile psyche. Not only that, but whatever force dwells behind the shimmering glass seems to have gained the power to alter reality as well. After Ben gazes into the mirrors and sees a vision of himself being relentlessly tortured, he is horrified to experience violent convulsions, spontaneous bleeding, and frightening asphyxiation. And while his sister is always willing to lend a sympathetic ear, she chalks the anomalies up to an unusually potent mix of stress and anxiety. Unfortunately for Ben, his estranged wife, Amy (Paula Patton), isn't nearly as forgiving. A prosaic NYPD medical examiner who has seen her fair share of tragedy, Amy fears that Ben's erratic behavior could be placing their children in danger. Later, as Ben begins to draw connections between his increasingly gruesome visions and a former Mayflower security guard who vanished without a trace, he begins to suspect that an unimaginable evil is using the mirrors as a gateway into the real world, and that his family is in mortal danger from forces beyond their realm of understanding. Perhaps if he Ben can manage to convince Amy that their children's lives are at risk, he can summon the courage to face the greatest evil he has ever known(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way

programme.desc: Cranes and Cats of the Mara River. Fundi the cheetah and her cubs return to the area, Half-tail the leopard protects her cub from lionesses at Fig Tree Ridge(n)

programme.title: Too Cute!
programme.desc: Kittens. The first few months of three litters of kittens, including Abyssinians, Bengals and Persians, are observed(n)

programme.title: Cats 101
programme.sub-title: Maine Coon, Egyptian Mau, Siamese, Himalayan, Oriental and Turkish Angora
programme.desc: Maine Coon, Egyptian Mau, Siamese, Himalayan, Oriental and Turkish Angora. Maine Coon, Egyptian Mau, Siamese, Himalayan, Oriental, Turkish Angora: Which cat has the longest whiskers? Which breed comes in 300 colour combinations? Which breed can be born cross-eyed? And which feline has a flap of skin that helps it run faster?(n)

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Fifi's Ruining My Love Life. An exotic-pet owner dislikes his girlfriend's spunky cat; a cat objects to its owner's new live-in girlfriend(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix
programme.desc: Chain Break. An underweight Rottweiler is chained in the blazing sun; a search is on for kittens trapped under roof tiles; a dog that was attacked by coyotes fights for its life(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix
programme.desc: Puppies in a Pipe. A neglected dog with a leg injury is rescued; a mother and nine puppies are found in a storm drain; three kittens and their mother get a lifesaving operation(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Crisis. Tia deals with an array of problems as she picks up the slack for her unhelpful daughter. And a parolee goes missing(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Sin City. Tia is offered a benefit gig at a Las Vegas casino and the shelter needs the cash. First she must deal with a major crisis with one of her most trusted parolees(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Himalayan Giant. Conclusion. Jeremy visits India in 2005 to search for the dangerous goonch catfish(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Piranha. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade goes to extraordinary lengths in his mission to find out whether the piranha of the Amazon basin is truly the river monster of nightmares. In Brazil, he swims with them, inciting the piranhas into a feeding frenzy, and also tracks down survivors and eyewitnesses of piranha attacks. In one incident from 1976, 39 people died when a coach crashed into the river and some bodies were so badly mutilated that they could only be identified by their clothes. Is this proof that piranhas do live up to their fearsome reputation?(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Alaskan Horror. Jeremy Wade goes into the forbidding Alaskan wilderness to visit two large lakes where legend has it people have been vanishing for hundreds of years. Jeremy cannot resist a challenge and is intrigued to see if there is a native species of lake monster that has been pulling fishermen into the icy depths. This is new territory for him, as he has never done any sub-Arctic fishing before. He does not fall victim to the frozen waters - but he does land probably the largest fish he has ever caught(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Chainsaw Predator. Biologist and extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on a mission to find some of the world's most terrifying fish. In this episode, he goes to the Australian outback to try to catch the rare and fearsome freshwater sawfish, which can measure up to 18 feet long. Why does this shadowy sea monster travel hundreds of miles inland - and is it really a killer? Jeremy roams the beguiling landscape and encounters scientists and a real-life Crocodile Dundee before finally confronting the disturbing truth(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Asian Slayer. When Jeremy Wade travels to the Himalayas to investigate river attacks, he learns that the suspected culprit is a sacred animal. Does he heed warnings not to touch the creature?(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: American Killers. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade travels around the globe searching for fresh water monsters. In this episode, he travels to the USA after hearing stories of corpses in the waters in some of the country's tourist hotspots. Are they true or are they just myth? He meets people who have encountered this beast and hears tales of a killer catfish. Jeremy even considers using himself as human bait such is his determination to discover the truth behind these stories(n)

programme.title: River Monsters: How to Catch a River Monster
programme.desc: Jungle Terminator. In an enhanced episode, Jeremy goes to the Amazon rain forest to investigate three separate deaths in Brazil, Colombia and Peru, and seeks guidance from the Matis tribe in the Brazilian jungle(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Ice Cold Killer. A sea monster washes up on an English beach, kicking off Jeremy's journey of discovery that leads to the ice sheets of Greenland and the fjords of Norway, all ahead of an Arctic storm that threatens to ruin his quest(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Mekong Mutilator. Jeremy goes to Cambodia to explore the Mekong River to investigate reports of an aquatic predator, but he must also watch out for unexploded ordnance that may be left over from the Vietnam War(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Killer Torpedo. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade ventures deep into Central America in search of a killer fish which is said to leap into boats and cause fatal injuries. Believed to reach eight feet in length and weighing up to 300 pounds, it instils fear in all who encounter it. Jeremy has to relearn everything he knows about fishing to attempt to catch this deadly creature. Will he be successful in hunting it down? Ser. 5, Ep. 3(n)

Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.desc: By the Labour Party.(n)

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals get under way with the nine remaining contenders facing just one test to keep themselves in the competition. They have 90 minutes to cook dishes showcasing their favourite ingredients, with their choices including lamb, cauliflower and seaweed, before one of the hopefuls is eliminated.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle begins her community service, and while Ian and Sharon show their support, Louise, Madison and Alexandra do their best to make things difficult for her. Woody's latest managerial decision does not go down too well with the residents, Denise hides her financial troubles from her friends and family, and Jack tries to get back to normal. Konrad continues to flirt with Shirley.(n)

programme.title: Saving Mr Banks
programme.desc: Walt Disney becomes determined to adapt Mary Poppins into a film, but faces an obstacle in the shape of author PL Travers, who resists the idea of a sentimental Hollywood version of her book. As the movie mogul's charm offensive comes unstuck, he begins to realise why the story is so important to its creator. Fact-based drama, with Emma Thompson, Tom Hanks, Paul Giamatti and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Agnes invites one last selection of celebrities into her home, as her Saturday night chat show concludes. This time, actor, singer and West End star Michael Ball pulls up a chair in Mrs Brown's sitting room, along with actress and one-time Strictly Come Dancing contestant Sunetra Sarker, most recently been seen in guest roles in both Death in Paradise and Broadchurch. Most Haunted presenter Yvette Fielding lends her ghost-hunting skills to Dermot and Buster during their Celebrity Haunted House tour, and the Vamps perform in session at Foleys. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: TV and radio presenter Kirsty Young hosts an extended edition of the current affairs quiz, with comedian Jon Richardson and journalist Robert Peston the guests joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Oscar-winning Hollywood great Goldie Hawn and stand-up comedian and actress Amy Schumer discuss their new action-comedy Snatched. Plus, John Boyega - Finn in Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens - talks about appearing in Woyzeck at London's Old Vic and Orlando Bloom discusses his new big-screen thriller Unlocked. Singer Lucie Jones performs Never Give Up on You, the UK's Eurovision entry at next month's contest in Kiev.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon explore the level of risk from hackers - and the impact it can have if they are able to get hold of personal details.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in Leamington Spa, Plumstead and the Isle of Sheppey.(n)

programme.title: The Wanted
programme.desc: Manchester's Force Critical Wanted Unit deal with a threat to life as a violent suspect is hunted down, and in Oldham the team tracks down a juvenile offender.(n)

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: IFED pay a visit to a fraudster selling fake motor insurance policies, and a driver's attempt to land a bumper pay out by reversing into a delivery van is caught on camera.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Teams led by Danny Sebastian and Gary Pe search for antique bargains at the Westpoint Arena near Exeter, before host Natasha Raskin Sharp announces the winners.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Al has to turn to Rob for help after missing some vital clues, Mrs Tembe tries out her recipes on a chef and Ruhma and Karen become competitive, but one of them is cheating.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is with a Norfolk father and daughter, who hope their £700k budget will afford them an equestrian property and annexe to house their family and horse.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich Brothers compete to design a £5,000 family garden in Southampton, ensuring it is safe for toddler Alex.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden Vs Danny Sebastian Auction.
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Danny Sebastian battle for lots at a London auction house. While Jonty finds himself in a world of fashion, Danny muscles in on his territory.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Conservative Party.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kush is frustrated with Denise for spending so much time on her GCSE revision, so he persuades her to take the evening off - only to receive a dinner invitation from his mother. Louise agrees to have Madison and Alexandra over to her house on Thursday - unaware they are plotting something - and Ian tries to make Jane's birthday special, although she is the one with a surprise.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mo finds herself caught between pregnant patient Trixie and Derwood's overbearing mother, while Oliver's eagerness to impress causes friction between Bernie and Ric. Sacha revisits his own childhood when his first girlfriend is admitted and the secret of his romantic history goes viral, and Essie finds a box of contraceptives in Parker's school bag.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: John enlists the help of his Nan to reluctantly wait in for a parcel delivery, while Kayleigh wants to know where she stands with her colleague. Will they finally get together, or will his daydreaming soul mate look for a lift elsewhere? Sitcom, co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Our Friend Victoria
programme.desc: Maxine Peake explores Victoria Wood's take on appearance, how the comedian took swipes at society's views on how people look, and what they should wear and eat. Comedy clips sum up Victoria's views on the diet and health industry. Plus, Julie Walters and Celia Imrie ponder Acorn Antiques' transformation into a health spa, and Duncan Preston reveals the pain he endured when faced with a wrinkly gusset.(n)

programme.title: British Jews, German Passports
programme.desc: After Brexit, thousands of British people have applied for dual nationality. But for the British Jewish community, many of who are the descendants of those who fled Nazi Germany, this poses a dilemma. Cameras follow three British Jews as they decide whether to activate a clause in the German Constitution that permits descendants of German refugees to reclaim citizenship.(n)

programme.title: Richard and Jaco: Life with Autism
programme.desc: Jaco Mylan is like many 11-year-old boys. He loves rugby, dancing and also has autism. In this documentary Welsh actor Richard Mylan reflects on his experience of raising a son on the autistic spectrum and discusses his hopes for Jaco in the future.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.sub-title: Tools of the Trade - Part Two.
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the show's experts offer more advice on making money from antiques and collectibles, with this edition focusing on antique domestic tools - including the most expensive ear cleaner that James Lewis has ever encountered.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and siblings David and Harry Rich compete to design a £3,000 beach-themed garden for a family of three generations. Narrated by Lucinda Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Two antiques experts put their own cash on the line as they compete to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce returns for a second episode from Pembroke Castle in West Wales. Items brought in to be valued include a sapphire ring that changes colour in different light, a papal hat that once belonged to Pope Pius XII, and a collection of Anglo-Indian paintings from 1780 that were once used to decorate a village's scout hut.(n)

programme.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
programme.desc: Villagers try to save their railway branch from closure by taking it over as a public business - but the owners of the local bus company try to sabotage their plans, forcing them to resort to more underhand methods. Ealing comedy, starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph, John Gregson, Godfrey Tearle and Sid James.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A profile of actor David Niven. The documentary highlights the film and television appearances he made over the years and captures the milestones of his fame, including his role as Phileas Fogg in Michael Todd's production of Around the World in 80 Days. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Victorian gentleman Phileas Fogg wagers he and his loyal valet Passepartout can circumnavigate the globe in only 80 days. Oscar-winning period adventure, based on Jules Verne's novel, starring David Niven, Cantinflas and Shirley MacLaine, with cameo appearances by stars including Noel Coward, Marlene Dietrich, Frank Sinatra, Buster Keaton and John Gielgud.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Final: Session Three.
programme.desc: Mark Selby v John Higgins. Hazel Irvine presents coverage from the third session of the final, as the players face a potential eight frames in the ranking tournament at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield. Ding Junhui trailed 7-10 overnight in last year's final as he tried to win the tournament for the first time in his career, but, despite closing the gap on Mark Selby to 10-11, he still ended the session with a three-frame deficit to make up.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc drives an eight-wheeled rescue vehicle from Russia, Rory Reid turns the world's ugliest car into a luxury yacht, and Chris Harris reviews the new Porsche Cayman. Plus, Jamiroquai frontman Jay Kay is the studio guest.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Final: Session Four.
programme.desc: Mark Selby v John Higgins. Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the concluding session of this year's final at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where the successful player needs to reach 18 frames to lift the famous trophy. Ding Junhui compiled the only century break in this session of last year's final, but that would have been scant consolation to the Chinese star, as he was unable to reel in Mark Selby's lead, as the world number one edged to his second world title, eventually winning 18-14 to cement his place at the top of the rankings in style. The commentary team features Dennis Taylor, Willie Thorne, Steve Davis, Ken Doherty, John Virgo, John Parrott and Stephen Hendry.(n)

programme.title: Margin Call
programme.desc: A bitter executive is dismissed from an investment bank, but plans his revenge by handing secret information on the company's fortunes to a junior analyst. When the information is decoded, it reveals that the company is on the brink of a devastating financial crisis, a revelation that is soon spreading throughout the workforce. Drama, starring Kevin Spacey, Paul Bettany and Jeremy Irons.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team explores County Durham, where Matt Baker demonstrates how to make a traditional regional dish and Ellie Harrison takes a trip up the River Tees. Sean Fletcher meets a boy scout pack involved in wildlife projects, Tom Heap reports on fly tipping, and Adam Henson meets beef farmers who feed their cows on grass alone.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at Giraffe Manor in Kenya, a unique hotel where giraffe, staff and guests co-exist in a 1930s Scottish-style hunting lodge on the edge of Nairobi National Park. The pair travel to the remote but luxurious outpost of Sasaab Lodge, a six-acre plot set within 82,000 acres of land owned by Samburu tribespeople, who receive a fee for every guest that stays and make up 75 per cent of the staff.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts offer advice on buying and selling military memorabilia from various conflicts around the world. Presenter Paul Martin explores the issues surrounding collecting antique firearms and David Fletcher explains why he would never part with a plaque commemorating his great uncle's death during the First World War.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Dave and Harry Rich head to Watford, Hertfordshire, where they come up with ideas for a couple who want a space to remind them of their former garden in Africa.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Danny Sebastian go antique-hunting in Annecy, south-east France, where Jonty unearths a Salvador Dali etching and Danny finds a vintage sewing table.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Lawrence, Kansas, Michael Portillo joins the Jayhawks basketball team in the famous Allen Field house stadium with energetic encouragement from their cheerleaders, before travelling through Tornado Alley to Topeka to meet one of the first storm chasers in America. Driving out on the Great Plains, Michael learns about the Tallgrass Prairie and comes face to face with a herd of wild buffalo.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Jo Coburn presents the latest from the campaign trail.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest fixtures, including Castleford Tigers v Wigan Warriors, Hull FC v Warrington Wolves and St Helens v Leigh Centurions.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Nick Crane ventures out into the Portland Tidal Race to see how this fearsome tidal surge creates some of the roughest waters in Britain, surprisingly close to the tourist beaches and Georgian splendour of Weymouth.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The work of Martyn Colbeck, who for more than 15 years has photographed and filmed the African elephant in all its habitats, including the deep Congo jungle and the sands of the Namibian desert. He describes how he has witnessed large bulls in a deadly duel and recorded the family matriarch giving birth at night.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Inspector George Gently and The Professionals star Martin Shaw is the latest celebrity to go in search of his roots, and he's particularly interested in finding out more about his paternal grandfather Edwin, who was rarely spoken about by his family. The actor has only one photo of his ancestor, which shows him aged roughly 17 and wearing a military uniform. By zooming in on the picture, Martin's brother was able to identify their grandfather's badge, which suggests he was in the Royal Marines. Now, by meeting with a military historian, Martin tries to fill in the rest of the story, and in the process learns more about Edwin's role in defending Birmingham against German air assaults during the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Darren Kiely is discovered badly beaten and the Gardai hope it is not the start of a fresh feud between his family and the Hennessys. Crime drama, with Jack Nolan.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Sharon Cleere is asked to deliver tragic news about the daughter of a dying man, while Bridget Kiely persuades her youngest son Keith to kill Michael Hennessy.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Elizabeth Talbot and Paul Laidlaw hunt for antiques in the Bowes Museum at Barnard Castle in County Durham, with finds including a silver tea set and a Russian drinking cup. Plus, Paul Martin looks at the museum's extraordinary lace collection.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Susan Calman, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Tim Vine help, or hinder, teaching assistant Amanda from Enfield in the quiz hosted by Patrick Kielty.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: New series. As the cooking contest returns, 24 chefs compete for a chance to show off their culinary skills at a banquet honouring 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. This week it's the turn of three chefs from London and the South East who are all first timers in the competition. Tom Kemble, Mike Reid and Selin Kiazim meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their summery starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mike Reid shocks with when he pairs his fish with white chocolate and strawberry. Selin Kiazim's dish uses barbecued octopus and potato rostis as the central elements, while Tom Kemble creates poached buttered trout, but will it be enough to impress the show's veteran chef?.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: The four remaining teams of professional pastry chefs create 36 identical petite charlottes and 36 shaped macarons in two hours. For their final challenge the teams must put an innovative spin on the classic towering French celebration cake, the croquembouche, all of which will be judged by Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin. Angus Deayton hosts.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Why Did I Go Mad?.
programme.desc: For hundreds of years, psychiatry has treated voices and hallucinations as an enemy. But today new scientific and psychological insights into how the brain works are leading to a radical rethink on what such experiences are - and how they should be treated. Cameras follow three people living with voices, hallucinations and paranoia, to explore what causes this kind of phenomena.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The pianist welcomes Debbie Harry's enduring outfit Blondie, who present a couple of tracks from their new studio album, Pollinator. Plus, music by London duo Binker and Moses, Baltimore band Future Islands perform numbers from their fifth LP, The Far Field, and London newcomer Mabel makes her TV debut. There are also pieces by Senegal's Orchestra Baobab, who are celebrating almost half a century in the music business, and acclaimed trio London Grammar, whose second album, Truth Is a Beautiful Thing, is released in June.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: After the success of their B&B venture, the group decide to open a restaurant called La Banditaccia on the farm. To get some inspiration for their menu, some of the group head to the city of Florence, and take in the delights of the local markets. On their return, they invite some locals for dinner at the farm, and offer them their unique take on Italian cuisine. However, the group are soon impelled to turn their attention to the upcoming olive harvest when a swarm of flies heading towards the region puts the olives under threat.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Orangutan Diary
programme.desc: Michaela Strachan deals with a crisis at the rescue centre as a newly arrived baby fights for its life, but there is good news as her favourite orphan Lomon starts to make progress. Steve Leonard lends a hand at the forest school, where young apes learn skills to equip them for life in the wild, but gets a surprise when an orang-utan starts to give birth at the back of the centre.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: Penny Blacks & Twopenny Blues - How Britain Got Stuck on Stamps.
programme.desc: Andrew Martin charts the evolution of British postage stamps and looks at how they became a national obsession, examining iconic examples and famous collectors, as well as meeting modern-day philatelists at a club.(n)

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc: New series. Historian Janina Ramirez and art critic Alastair Sooke embark on cultural city breaks, offering insights into the most famous locations and uncovering hidden gems and untold stories to reveal how religion, revolution and trailblazing individuals can shape the art - and soul - of a metropolis. They begin by examining the art and design of the Dutch capital Amsterdam, along the way discovering how its culture reflects the liberal attitudes, appetite for global trade and love of home comforts that helped shape the character of this city.(n)

programme.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
programme.desc: A girl takes up the job of maid in the household of the artist Vermeer - but her presence provokes friction in the family and the jealousy of his wife when the servant catches the painter's eye. Peter Webber's 17th-century period drama adapted from the best-selling novel by Tracy Chevalier, starring Scarlett Johansson, Colin Firth, Tom Wilkinson, Judy Parfitt and Cillian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Harlots, Housewives & Heroines: A 17th Century History for Girls
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley examines the lives of women in Restoration England, discovering how some were able to thrive as British society started to move into the modern age - even if the attitudes that prevailed remained largely medieval and misogynistic. She begins by profiling Charles II's mistresses, including actress Nell Gwynn, royalist Barbara Villiers and French spy Louise de Keroualle, and explores the extent to which they were in control of their own destinies.(n)

programme.title: Botany: A Blooming History
programme.desc: Timothy Walker explores how mankind developed its understanding of plants, and demonstrates what the study of botany has revealed about life on Earth. He begins by tracing how the study of variation in plants became regarded as a scientific rather than religious discipline, and examines the creation of the first artificial hybrid flower, which forced botanists to reassess their theories about how plants are related.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Motorway
programme.desc: Examining Britain's motorways through the eyes of the people who built them, those who use the roads and protesters who tried to block their construction. The first programme considers the history of the UK's first stretch of motorway, the M6 Preston Bypass.(n)

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc: New series. Historian Janina Ramirez and art critic Alastair Sooke embark on cultural city breaks, offering insights into the most famous locations and uncovering hidden gems and untold stories to reveal how religion, revolution and trailblazing individuals can shape the art - and soul - of a metropolis. They begin by examining the art and design of the Dutch capital Amsterdam, along the way discovering how its culture reflects the liberal attitudes, appetite for global trade and love of home comforts that helped shape the character of this city.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Orangutan Diary
programme.desc: Orphans Grendon and Ellie continue to make progress, and even troubled Lomon makes great strides in the `Forest School' classes. However, the day is blighted when Steve Leonard travels to a village where a baby orang-utan is being held illegally - and an emotionally charged rescue takes place.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ireland: The Edge of the World
programme.desc: Part two of two. Colin Stafford-Johnson heads north from Clew Bay for Donegal - golden eagle country - before reaching the island's northern tip and turning east along the coast of Northern Ireland. Along the way he observes the whooper swans that fly in every autumn to escape the Arctic winter and the elusive pine marten, an animal resident in the area since the last Ice Age. Basking sharks, bats and salmon are among the other creatures Colin comes across as he seeks out the remotest corners of Ireland's wild west.(n)

programme.title: Shock and Awe: The Story of Electricity
programme.desc: Jim Al-Khalili charts how scientists discovered the connection between electricity and magnetism, and explains why this breakthrough gave mankind far greater control over electrical forces. He also reveals that their findings were crucial to the development of electricity as a mass-produced source of power, leading to innovations in communications, manufacturing, transport and technology.(n)

programme.title: Genius of the Modern World
programme.sub-title: Nietzsche: Genius of the Modern World.
programme.desc: Historian Bettany Hughes travels across Europe in the footsteps of the German philosopher Friedrich Nietzsche. His uncompromising and often brutal ideas smashed the comfortable assumptions of religion, morality and science, yet appropriated by the Nazis, his work is among the most devastatingly manipulated and misinterpreted in history. His philosophical quest led him to isolation and ultimately madness, but his ideas helped shape the intellectual landscape of the modern world.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Mankind's fascination with the frozen continent of Antarctica, from the early 20th-century race to be the first to reach the South Pole to modern scientific research into the region's geological properties. The programme reveals the story behind the photographs taken by Herbert Ponting on Captain Robert Falcon Scott's ill-fated 1912 polar expedition, explores the South Pole's role in famous literature by HP Lovecraft and Samuel Taylor Coleridge, and examines the continent's complicated political history. With contributions by Ranulph Fiennes, Sara Wheeler and Francis Spufford.(n)

Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 413. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 414. programme.desc: Episode 618. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 603. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 514. A woman tries to sell the Sharks on her special mud mask from Alaska. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 725. Two beer enthusiasts from Pittsburgh believe they have come up with the second-best invention of all time; a former aerospace engineer is determined to reinvent the vending machine; a pair from Austin pitch a safe bug repellent for household pets; and the Sharks taste-test a line of vegetable smoothies. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 527. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pair's friendship. However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg.(n)

programme.title: The House of Magic
programme.desc: A stray cat wanders into a magician's mansion, and finds it is full of strange gadgets. The illusionist allows him to stay, to the annoyance of his other pets, but the cat proves an invaluable addition to the group when their owner's scheming nephew plots to take the house for himself. Animated adventure, with the voices of Murray Blue and Doug Stone.(n)

programme.title: Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen
programme.desc: A New York teenager moves with her parents to a small town, where she quickly gets drawn into a bitter conflict with a local girl - until auditions for a musical give her the chance to outshine her rival. Meanwhile, she faces the challenge of working out how to get back to the big city for her favourite band's farewell concert. Drama, starring Lindsay Lohan, Adam Garcia, Glenne Headly and Alison Pill.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The same day is shown from three different perspectives as Bart is pursued by gangsters, Lisa makes a bid to win the school science fair with a talkative robot, and Marge accidentally slices off Homer's thumb. Featuring the guest voices of Frankie Muniz and Joe Mantegna.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge and rebellious new friend Ruth set off for a girls' night out - but end up being pursued at high speed through the streets of Springfield by Chief Wiggum and a distraught Homer.(n)

programme.desc: New series. Documentary following a group of elite bakers and sugarcraft specialists, beginning with a commission for a gravity-defying five-tier cake that will hang upside down.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In another horrific helping of grisly Halloween tales, Bart becomes a cyborg, Homer finds himself hunted in a macabre chase headed by Mr Burns, and a witch casts a spell on the residents of Springfield at a fancy-dress party.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes and Lily support Scott, while Simone makes a life-changing decision. Elsewhere, Neeta once again helps Sally with dating, and Ryan gets up to no good.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade explores the Austrian capital in the company of his IT Crowd co-star Chris O'Dowd. Over a packed mini-break, they sample the city's finest sausages, cakes, wines and spirits and visit fairgrounds, cafes and sewers, while Richard suffers an allergic reaction and Chris breaks something valuable.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Hoarders
programme.desc: Experts in the field of hoarding disorder spend over three months carefully treating two people who have a persistent difficulty in discarding or parting with possessions - hoping to transform their lives and mend their failing relationships. Sue in Nottinghamshire has hundreds of dolls all around her house, driving her partner Neil to despair, while Scott stores thousands of spare computer and hardware parts piled high in every room of the house he shares with wife Faith, including the bedroom and bathroom.(n)

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls
programme.desc: With old and young now living side by side, the islanders are hoping to hit their stride, but the lack of food is an ever-pressing concern and tempers are fraying. Jordan is feeling out of sorts and then has a fight with Richie, while the members of the group are furious when Phil uses some olive oil to boost the fire rather than for food. Soon there is another bust up, stretching relations between the participants to breaking point. Could a shocking vote see the islanders turn on one of their own?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Chris Addison taking on Joe Wilkinson and Katherine Ryan. David O'Doherty joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Alan Carr: Yap, Yap, Yap
programme.desc: A stand-up performance filmed at the Hammersmith Apollo, one of the venues on the award-winning performer's 158-date UK and Ireland tour of 2015. The comedian, author and chat show supremo is on top form as he regales the audience with tales of his dogs, going on safari with his mother, and flying high with Carol Vorderman.(n)

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers
programme.desc: Jay, Sketch and Alice cover up more tattoo regrets and give one loving sister a beautiful Mandala memorial. Nathan wants to banish his bad luck back tatt, Gina's `randy' chicken clucks off for good and Dan's tattoo story has a happy ending. Craig is giving his offensive football tatt the finger, Ollie's wheezy Magaluf inking is sent into orbit, while Alice gives Taylia a matching tattoo in honour of her sister. Previously seen on E4.(n)

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: British cleaners Hayley and Kris visit a retired academic, Professor Widdecombe in Vermont, USA, who hasn't properly cleaned his nine-bedroom historic property for a decade. The home is covered in cobwebs and cat hair, and each room is over-stuffed with possessions.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton is in Devon with Graham and Nicky Daniel, who are building an ambitious contemporary home on a woodland site, and are planning to tackle much of the work themselves. Previously seen on More4.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp are in south-east London with two couples for whom timing is critical. In and around the Isle of Dogs and Greenwich, Lia and Andrew have saved a big deposit and have a sizeable budget of £600,000 to spend. But, after witnessing the crash of 2008, Andrew is nervous of spending his hard-earned money for fear the market will dip. Lucy and Dan live in a B&B and if they don't find somewhere soon their vintage campervan will become their home. Kirstie shows the couple two potential properties, but the third option creates a reaction she isn't expecting and suddenly the search is thrown up in the air.(n)

programme.title: Raga: A Film Journey into the Soul of India
programme.desc: Documentary following Indian sitar maestro Ravi Shankar in the late 1960s, exploring his life as a musician and teacher in the US and Europe and looking at his influences and work with Yehudi Menuhin and George Harrison.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is taught how to bind books by expert Isabelle Ting, and reveals how to create a notebook from leftover materials including leather offcuts, recycled leather coats and decorative paper.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Debra gets involved in a heated dispute with another parent at Ally's little league baseball match, but Ray fails to take her side because he is afraid of making himself unpopular. Dan Castellaneta, better known as the voice of Homer Simpson, guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert's traffic-school students complain they are fed up with his class, so he resorts to teaching them using a puppet - an innovation that proves far from boring. American comedy, starring Brad Garrett and Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: A discovery makes Ray worry about his mortality - and prompts him to compile a list of things he wants to do before he dies. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.desc: A shady character helps the Crane brothers get Maris out of a spot of legal trouble - then demands they return the favour by persuading his girlfriend to marry him. Comedy, guest starring Harris Yulin, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles is left jumping for joy by an exciting proposal from Maris, while Frasier suggests the family tries something different to mark the leap year. However, all his efforts end in disaster. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend visit petrol-head Kim in Hampshire, the owner of an accident-damaged 1995 Nissan Skyline GT-R. The team take on the challenge of transforming her Japanese supercar into a street racer's dream.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay heads to Windsor, Vermont, on a mission to boost the fortunes of the Juniper Hill Inn, which may look impressive, but smells of raw sewage owing to a plumbing problem. After meeting the B&B's wealthy owner Robert Dean II, the chef uncovers some shocking treatment toward staff and realises he will need something approaching a miracle to save this business from disaster.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.desc: Quiz in which seven contestants are locked in a jury room and must work together to answer questions correctly and accumulate as much money as possible, but only one of them will get the chance to leave at the end of the show with that day's total prize fund.(n)

However, it remains to be seen if Cupid's arrow strikes any of them.(n)

Here cameras following the divided family over the course of a make-or-break 18 months.(n)
