programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares fig and fennel caponata, an antipasto platter and Tuscan mashed chickpeas for the team who built her barn.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares raspberry muffins and coffee for breakfast, before heading to local restaurant South Fork Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Recipes for desserts, including fruit filled cranberry and apple cake. There is also a masterclass from patisserie chef Claudia Fleming, who prepares lemon cream napoleon.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten cooks up classics and new takes on her favourite Italian dishes, including roasted tomatoes with pesto and parmesan.(n)

programme.title: Bake with Anna Olson
programme.desc: Anna shares her secrets on how to make her favourite squares beginning with a rich classic - fudge brownies.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Cooking with a group of women anglers and fishers, can Ezra and Julie convince chef and fly-fisher Kathy to trade in her deep fryer for fresh, local ingredients?.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While Ree's husband Ladd and his father Chuck dismantle a historic cattle feed storehouse, she cooks them a lunch of juicy steak and eggs benedict.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Hoping to encounter the cowboys he admired as a child, Jamie Oliver heads for Cody in Wyoming, where he samples one of the staples of a cattleman's diet - pitchfork fondue. The chef also gets the chance to ride a bucking bronco on rodeo night and meets rancher Hip Tillet, who teaches him how to prepare local speciality Rocky Mountain oysters.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo explores the healthy fast food in Seoul on offer to commuters, from smartphone shopping to frozen yoghurt. Back home, she serves up a ramyun noodle dish.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo introduces Korea's famous barbecue dishes with the help of K-pop band, UKiss, and her parents. At home, she makes Korean-American style barbecue chicken.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Sizzling Beef Steak and Mighty Mackerel.
programme.desc: In another demonstration of how to create tasty meals fast, Jamie Oliver prepares sizzling beef steak with hoi sin prawn and noodle bowls, and mackerel with mixed tomato and quinoa salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Steak, Liver and Bacon and Mexican Tomato Soup.
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares a selection of dishes including Mexican tomato soup, chilli nachos and veggie and feta sprinkles, plus steak, liver and bacon, bubble and squeak mash, and red onion gravy.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Hoping to encounter the cowboys he admired as a child, Jamie Oliver heads for Cody in Wyoming, where he samples one of the staples of a cattleman's diet - pitchfork fondue. The chef also gets the chance to ride a bucking bronco on rodeo night and meets rancher Hip Tillet, who teaches him how to prepare local speciality Rocky Mountain oysters.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's cooks hearty breakfast biscuits that her husband and son are coming to collect on their way to feed the cattle.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is sharing four vibrant recipes to celebrate the colours of summer.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Chef Judy Joo visits rural Korea and some of the food festivals in the autumn, celebrating the harvest and kimchi. She samples the soups and stews eaten at this time of year.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo introduces the staples of the Korean pantry - chilli paste, rice and green tea crop-visiting, a gochujang village, a rice harvest and tea plantations.(n)

programme.title: Kids Baking Championship
programme.desc: The four remaining young bakers must make a dessert item that looks like a savoury dish and also create a savoury cupcake.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The travelling chef heads for New York, shunning the glamour of Manhattan to discover an underground gastronomic subculture run by some of the Big Apple's most colourful culinary personalities. In Queens, he meets a pioneer of Egyptian-style home-cooked food, and discovers two home-run restaurants providing the city's diners with exotic dishes at economy prices.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Glazed Pork Fillet And Tapas Bruschetta.
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a glazed pork fillet accompanied by Cajun-style pepper rice and barbecue sauce, plus a tapas bruschetta and golden grilled sardines.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Lamb Kofte and Keralan Veggie Curry.
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver continues to demonstrate his own brand of fast food, showing how to prepare lamb kofte, pitta and Greek salad, and shares a recipe for Keralan vegetarian curry, poppadoms, rice and minty yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a roadside bar in Parkland, serving up sandwiches stuffed with brisket and crispy pork belly.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Cincinnati to visit three restaurants on one street. First up is the pub where a husband and wife duo dish out all kinds of creative hot dogs and sandwiches.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Minneapolis, where a gastropub is serving sandwiches piled with steak and braised beef, and Atlanta, where a Jewish deli sells a fish specialty and pastrami hash.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri samples beef empanadas and a veggie tart speciality at an Argentinian joint in Denver, and eats a Tex-Mex breakfast at a homestyle spot in Massachusetts.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine faces the challenge of saving the Sweet Tea's Restaurant and Catering from failure in just two days and with a budget of only $10,000.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When Chef Chai, owner of his namesake restaurant in Honolulu, notices multiple ticket voids, he contacts Charles Stiles for help. Mystery Diners go undercover to see if his staff is making honest mistakes or committing foul play.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Lenny's Deli in Los Angeles asks Charles to investigate a baker who he fears is taking license with cake orders. Mystery Diners Kiel and Kendall go undercover and discover an even bigger problem in the deli.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie discovers Marlene has been discussing their marital problems with a counsellor, and the subsequent row results in him being thrown out of the house. With the hotel booked up and his car in a pond, Boycie's only option is to sleep on Bryan's caravan floor. Comedy, starring John Challis and Sue Holderness.(n)

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: Ria receives a letter from Leonard when he returns from New York, but before she gets the opportunity to open the envelope, Ruby manages to lose it. Comedy by Carla Lane, starring Wendy Craig, Geoffrey Palmer and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren is so excited about her forthcoming holiday with Tony she even considers buying some new clothes, and while a forlorn Stan tells everyone his sad news, Petula gets a little hot under the collar in her caravan. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Julie Walters.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The staff have a bet on Bren's chances of romance with Tony, but the hapless cook's past finally catches up with her and threatens to ruin any prospects of romance. Meanwhile, Stan is furious with Philippa for failing to save the bulbs from last year's Christmas tree lights. Comedy, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Thelma Barlow, Andrew Dunn, Celia Imrie and Shobna Gulati.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Twinkle and Stan spoil Petula's plans for a peaceful family Christmas, and a baby is found abandoned near the canteen. Bren's romance with Tony is ruined by the unexpected reappearance of her husband, and Anita goes away - but leaves her inflatable man behind. Festive special from 1999, starring Victoria Wood.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The crew prepares for the millennium dinner at the Old Brewery and it is a race against time to get things organised. Tony makes a discovery on the fire escape that puts a damper on the festivities.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Petula's bizarre lifestyle finally catches up with her, forcing Bren to make a difficult decision, and a new member of staff commits a terrible faux pas when she makes the tea. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood, Thelma Barlow and Julie Walters.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren frets over the implementation of a new DIY table-clearing initiative, but it is the least of her worries as a lack of funds looks set to thwart her plans with Tony. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Andrew Dunn.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Tony worries Bren will be distracted during her TV debut. Stan hopes for a proposal and Dolly is so upset at the design of the new uniforms that she considers drastic action. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Thelma Barlow.(n)

programme.title: Miranda
programme.desc: The shop owner's friends accuse her of being immature, so she sets out to prove she can officially be an adult. First she looks after a toddler - only to find the lure of the soft-play centre just too tempting - and then hosts a dinner party for eight, where disaster is on the menu. Comedy, starring Miranda Hart, Tom Ellis and Patricia Hodge.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Social climber Hyacinth indulges another of her flamboyant whims and decides she and Richard need a new car - but a modest three-door hatchback is not what she had in mind. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth plans a candlelit supper to impress Emmet with her singing talents, but fate intervenes and the event does not go as expected. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and David Griffin.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth learns the Barker-Finches had a local celebrity at their barbecue, and is desperate to outdo them with her own event - an `outdoors indoors luxury barbecue and finger buffet'. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth agrees to meet the Ladies' Luncheon Club's VIP at the railway station - but the assignment proves more difficult than imagined. Nigel Davenport guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Passions erupt in Dibley when Geraldine plays Cupid in her efforts to bring Alice and Hugo together, and at the same time she receives an astonishing proposal from an unexpected source. Christmas edition from 1997 starring Dawn French.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: The villagers set up a radio station to mark the 650th anniversary of St Barnabus's Church. While Alice tries to impress her future father-in-law, Frank makes a startling admission on his show.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Geraldine rockets to stardom following an appearance on Terry Wogan's radio show, but finds fame something of a bugbear. Meanwhile, the Dibley Gala organisers prepare for a knockout performance. Guest starring former ballerina Darcey Bussell, with Dawn French and Gary Waldhorn.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Alice shocks Geraldine with a monumental pre-wedding revelation, and the irreverent vicar is pleasantly surprised by David's dashing brother. Comedy, guest starring Clive Mantle, with Dawn French and Emma Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Festive special of the comedy from 2004. Edina decides her kitchen needs redecorating, but ends up needing regression therapy. Meanwhile, Mother and Saffy try to cope with bringing up the baby amid all the chaos and Bubble gets ideas above her station. Starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley, Julia Sawalha, June Whitfield and Jane Horrocks, with appearances by Miranda Richardson, Patrick Barlow and Laurie Metcalf.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sarah Millican, Russell Kane and Steve Hughes.
programme.desc: Sarah Millican hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, introducing routines by Australian funnyman Steve Hughes and award-winning comic Russell Kane, who both give their own take on modern life.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy meets his hero - techno musician Russell `The Orgazoid' - and ends up working as his handyman. However, the job seems to consist of making smoothies and swimming in his employer's pool - sparking speculation over the star's intentions. Mark goes to a school reunion and considers embarking on an illicit affair.(n)

programme.title: Gimme Gimme Gimme
programme.desc: Tom lands a make-or-break part in a play, but as nerves get the better of him he turns to man-eating Linda for her support. Fortunately, she is only too happy to oblige - especially if she gets the chance to meet a certain Hollywood hunk.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: The housemates have a sleepless night as pyjama-clad Gary goes in search of a 24-hour chemist to cure Dorothy's indigestion and Deborah sends Tony to mend a squeaking fence. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: Shooting Stars
programme.desc: Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer present the comedy quiz show, in which contestants are challenged to face off against various beasts, and witness one of Vic's unforgettable dance moves. Former Pussycat Doll Kimberly Wyatt and ex-talk show host Trisha Goddard join Jack Dee's team, while Ulrika Jonsson enlists music promoter-turned-reality TV star David Gest, and comedian Ben Miller.(n)

programme.title: Shooting Stars
programme.desc: Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer present the comedy quiz show, which sees contestants facing a unique form of interrogation, before joining the hosts for a picnic. The guests are singer Tulisa, Strictly Come Dancing performer Brendan Cole, football analyst Chris Kamara and war correspondent John Simpson, along with regular team captains Jack Dee and Ulrika Jonsson.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sarah Millican, Russell Kane and Steve Hughes.
programme.desc: Sarah Millican hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, introducing routines by Australian funnyman Steve Hughes and award-winning comic Russell Kane, who both give their own take on modern life.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: Jill moves in with Glenn after discovering he is wealthy and seems determined to make a fresh start - until her past finally catches up with her. Black comedy, starring Julia Davis, Mark Gatiss and Angus Deayton.(n)

programme.desc: Martin's sense of authority begins to wane when the arrival of new neighbour Paul threatens the equilibrium in his community. programme.desc: Jean ponders giving up work and handing the company over to Judith and Sandy - much to Lionel's delight. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.desc: Hyacinth plans a candlelit supper to impress Emmet with her singing talents, but fate intervenes and the event does not go as expected. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and David Griffin.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth learns the Barker-Finches had a local celebrity at their barbecue, and is desperate to outdo them with her own event - an `outdoors indoors luxury barbecue and finger buffet'. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth agrees to meet the Ladies' Luncheon Club's VIP at the railway station - but the assignment proves more difficult than imagined. Nigel Davenport guest stars.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: An elderly patient comes to the surgery for treatment and confesses to having an affair with a much younger woman - before dying in the dentist's chair. To cause further confusion, the man's wife and mistress come looking for Ben, arousing Susan's suspicions. Comedy, guest starring Eric Sykes.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's sense of authority begins to wane when the arrival of new neighbour Paul threatens the equilibrium in his community. The first episode of the sitcom, starring Richard Briers as an obsessive middle-aged man who yearns to be at the centre of his local suburban neighbourhood. With Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan. First broadcast in 1984.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy is given a lucky charm, but soon discovers exactly who is shaping his destiny.(n)

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads
programme.sub-title: Some Day We'll Laugh About This.
programme.desc: Terry carries out some home improvements for Bob and Thelma while they are on holiday. However, he finds himself sidetracked by the attentions of their attractive neighbour Sandra. Classic comedy, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes. First shown in 1974.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean ponders giving up work and handing the company over to Judith and Sandy - much to Lionel's delight. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly decides to put his extensive police training to good use by roping Compo and Clegg into his newly formed active rescue team, and finds there is only one thing stopping them becoming heroes - the lack of a casualty. Long-running comedy, starring Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Oh Howard, We Should Get One of Those.
programme.desc: Wesley's latest creation - a bed on wheel - meets with great approval, particularly with Compo who wants to be the first one to try it believing he has finally found the perfect way to get close to Nora Batty. Long-running comedy, starring Bill Owen, Gordon Wharmby and Kathy Staff.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: An elderly patient comes to the surgery for treatment and confesses to having an affair with a much younger woman - before dying in the dentist's chair. To cause further confusion, the man's wife and mistress come looking for Ben, arousing Susan's suspicions. Comedy, guest starring Eric Sykes.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del is invited to a school reunion at the Nag's Head organised by old adversary Roy Slater (Jim Broadbent), who has recently been released from prison and claims to have turned over a new leaf. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rich Hall, Mark Watson and Andrew Maxwell.
programme.desc: Rich Hall hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, doing his own thing before introducing routines by Mark Watson and Andrew Maxwell.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy organises Mark's stag weekend, which sees them set sail on a canal boat. The voyage seems to be a complete washout until a girl arrives to spice things up. Meanwhile, the groom-to-be gets offered an exciting job in India, providing a possible way out of his impending marriage to Sophie.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: The housemates have a sleepless night as pyjama-clad Gary goes in search of a 24-hour chemist to cure Dorothy's indigestion and Deborah sends Tony to mend a squeaking fence. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.sub-title: Phil Mickelson - Hall of Fame Career

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver studies the diets of the places that have the most centenarians in the world, before providing healthy recipes that can be cooked at home. In Costa Rica, he meets, cooks and eats with five generations of the same family, including 106-year-old Jose, while on the Greek island of Ikaria 84-year-old goat farmer Nikos gives him clues to the secrets of the locals' long lives. Back in the UK, Jamie creates a day's worth of nutritious and tasty meals, including griddled steak with toasted nuts and grilled peppers.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Nicoyan Peninsula in Costa Rica, where he joins fisherman Otto for a meal of freshly caught fish with family and friends on the beach. In Okinawa, an island 400 miles off the coast of Japan, Jamie joins a 74-year-old grand karate master to learn some moves before lunch, which features popular local ingredient sweet potato. Back in the UK, Jamie creates nutritious and tasty meals, including cheese and corn pancakes topped with smoky bacon and caramelised banana; fish tacos, and chicken and sweet potato cacciatore, with mushrooms, tomatoes, olives and bread.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels to the Greek island of Ikaria, where he forages for wild greens and herbs with local cook Tula, before preparing a healthy hilltop feast with four generations of her family. In Okinawa, Japan, Jamie joins local people for their early morning exercise and discovers the wonders of a local ancient ingredient.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is on the Greek island of Ikaria, where he helps 84-year-old Giorgios work the land and enjoys a lunch overlooking the sea, before visiting a Costa Rican cattle ranch where he eats black beans - a superfood packed with protein and fibre. Recipes featured include sweet potato, chilli, cheese and seed muffins, carbonara with smoky bacon, peas, almonds and basil, and smoky black bean stew with squash, peppers, rice and chili salsa.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: In Japan, Jamie Oliver harvests and eats seaweed - a superfood packed with immune system-boosting iron - before exploring Costa Ricans' love of fruit. Could it help to explain why they live so long? He then demonstrates recipes including baked eggs with cherry tomatoes and ricotta on toast, miso and chicken and mushrooms with wild rice, and prawns with vegetables and salsa.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver finds out whether wholegrain cracked wheat is a possible reason so many residents of the Greek island of Ikaria live for so long. He then heads to Okinawa in Japan to explore the secrets behind local fruit, vegetables, herbs and spices, and learns about the concept of nuchi gusui - `let food be your medicine'. Recipes include black-rice pudding with mango, lime, passion fruit and coconut, green-tea roasted salmon with ginger rice and sunshine salad, and seared turmeric chicken with hummus, peppers, couscous and greens.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: In Costa Rica's Nicoya peninsula, Jamie Oliver learns the importance of enjoying the simple things in life from a group of fisherman, as well as the benefits of adding fruit into classic recipes. On the Greek island of Ikaria, he discovers that adding a handful of nuts might boost longevity and in Okinawa, Japan, he finds out how locals treat food as medicine. Back in the UK, Jamie demonstrates recipes including pork and apple sauce, glazed carrots, brown rice and greens, Asian crispy beef, noodles and salad, and a healthy curried fish stew with a spicy kick.(n)

programme.title: Gok Cooks Chinese
programme.desc: Gok takes on some traditional Chinese dishes and methods as he prepares steamed lemon sole, Poppa Wan's easy Peking duck with pancakes and all the trimmings, and stewed aromatic aubergine. Plus, Gok gives the lowdown on his fool-proof rice.(n)

programme.title: Gok Cooks Chinese
programme.desc: Gok Wan demystifies Chinese dim sum, the selection of dumplings, steamed dishes and other ingredients, by serving up his own feast. Pointing out the importance of cooking with a bamboo steaming-basket, he then creates delicacies including chicken and leek pot stickers, chilli and salt squid with cucumber salad, pork ribs and black beans, and prawn and scallop moneybag dumplings.(n)

programme.title: Gok Cooks Chinese
programme.desc: Gok Wan cooks traditional street food, including lamb and cucumber kebabs and tender beef noodle soup. He then heads to Brixton, south London, for a dumpling-making race with Auntie Li, who is bringing real Beijing street food to south London.(n)

programme.title: Gok Cooks Chinese
programme.desc: Gok Wan finishes off the series by preparing a traditional Chinese feast. The centrepiece is a whole baked sea bass with ginger, spring onions and tomatoes, which is accompanied by twice-cooked melting pork and fragrant chicken wrapped in lettuce leaves.(n)

programme.title: David Rocco's India
programme.desc: David visits Bukhara, one of India's top restaurants, to try and get the secret of its renowned dal recipe and learn how to make a winning garam masala.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood assess how the remaining contestants cope with making pies and tarts. They begin with signature double-crusted fruit pies, make custard tarts in the technical challenge and finish by creating pies made with filo pastry for the showstopper. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second of this week's heats sees five more amateurs cooking a dish from scratch, and then recreating John Torode's seafood chowder and soda bread without a recipe. Two of them are then eliminated and the remaining three spend a busy lunchtime shift at London's Brasserie Joel, before heading back to the MasterChef kitchen to cook the final courses that will decide who goes through to the next round.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers examine a variety of traditional dishes reserved for birthdays, learning how to make Manchester tart, Greek stuffed vine leaves and a Caribbean Saturday soup. They also demonstrate how to prepare a summer berry trifle, and invite 200 women to sample one another's specialities.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: Chef James Martin journeys throughout the UK to explore how each region's conditions influence the flavour of local ingredients. After taking to the skies to get an overview of how Britain's landscape and climate affect where, what and how people farm and fish, he then touches down and meets the locals who work the land. He begins in the south east, where he finds out why Kent cherries are so sweet, cooks Hastings Dover sole and prepares a cherry trifle.(n)

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: In the lively surroundings of his Oxfordshire restaurant kitchen, chef Raymond Blanc shares recipes for cooks of all abilities. He begins by preparing four chocolate-based dishes - a fondant with a melting middle, a simple mousse, a rich delice, and a chocolate cup filled with mousse and coffee sabayon. He also visits the Richmond test kitchen of patissier William Curley.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Tom Kerridge takes over as host from Michel Roux Jr on the culinary show, and is joined on the first edition by Si King and Dave Myers. Tom challenges the Hairy Bikers to come up with a speedy meal to rival his quick sausage and bean casserole, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack surprises them all with his choice of wine to match the food. Plus, Fast Show star Arabella Weir goes behind the scenes at one of London's most upmarket hotels to discover the secret to making the perfect sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up piri piri pork belly with crispy crackling, frugal hangover noodles topped with Asian-style crispy and runny fried egg, and two very different ideas for making the most of leftover lamb from a roast - a biryani and a crunchy noodle salad. Plus, a midweek showstopper in the form of Jamie's grilled garlic mussels with sweet tomato soup, at just £1.30 a portion, and tips on how to use inexpensive frozen vegetables.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood assess how the remaining contestants cope with making pies and tarts. They begin with signature double-crusted fruit pies, make custard tarts in the technical challenge and finish by creating pies made with filo pastry for the showstopper. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A motley crew of high rollers races for a $2 million jackpot in this zany ensemble comedy from director Jerry Zucker ("Airplane!"). The fun begins when a Las Vegas casino bigwig (John Cleese) selects six people to hunt for a prize in New Mexico. Among the participants: an Italian narcoleptic (Rowan Atkinson), a gambler (Jon Lovitz) and a bighearted mom (Whoopi Goldberg). Seth Green(n)

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: An apartment block janitor discovers a magical woman in the swimming pool, who tells him that she has come from a children's fairytale and needs his help to return home. But something dangerous lurks in the woods as the story begins to take over the lives of the characters(n)

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: The people of Covington, a small town in rural Pennsylvania lead peaceful lives, only rarely disturbed by the creatures that inhabit the woods surrounding the village. An agreement has been reached with the creatures and peace prevails under the condition that the boundaries are respected. Yet this balance is disrupted when Lucius Hunt (Joaquin Phoenix), an inquisitive and willful young man, ventures himself beyond the limits of the village. After this, things will never be the same. Written and directed by M. Night Shyamalan, this is his third film after the huge success of The Sixth Sense(n)

programme.title: 2017 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony
programme.desc: The 32nd annual gala honors Joan Baez, Electric Light Orchestra, Journey, Pearl Jam, Tupac Shakur and Yes, and Nile Rodgers receives the Award for Musical Excellence. Taped April 7, 2017, in Brooklyn at the Barclays Center(n)

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Starring Nicolas Cage, Sam Rockwell and Alison Lohman. Directed by Ridley Scott. Roy, a highly phobic con artist, and his protégé, Frank, are on the verge of pulling off a lucrative swindle when the unexpected arrival of Roy's teenage daughter, Angela, disrupts his carefully ordered life and jeopardizes his high-risk scam(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Bruce Willis returns once again as John McClane, the wisecracking, old-school New York cop whose impressive CV includes rescuing hostages captured in a swanky LA plaza and saving passengers on a hijacked plane circling Washington. In this violent thriller, he's up against a group of terrorists threatening to hack into the US computer infrastructure. When they crash the stock market, sending the economy into meltdown and causing panic on Wall Street, McClane turns to young hacker Matt Farrell. Farrell's wanted by the FBI, but he's also potentially the only man who can help figure out the cyber criminals' next move. When the terrorists respond by kidnapping McClane's daughter Lucy, it's time for the anxious father to load up his ammo clips and go get the bad guys - just as the country's descending into chaos(n)

programme.title: Scream 2
programme.desc: When a couple are murdered at a showing of new horror film Stab, based on a tell-all book by reporter Gale Weathers (Courteney Cox), Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell) faces a fresh stalk 'n' slash nightmare. With a copycat killer targeting everybody around her, Sidney relies on old friend Dewey (David Arquette) for support. But can she survive a second attempt on her life? And just who can she really trust?(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A motley crew of high rollers races for a $2 million jackpot in this zany ensemble comedy from director Jerry Zucker ("Airplane!"). The fun begins when a Las Vegas casino bigwig (John Cleese) selects six people to hunt for a prize in New Mexico. Among the participants: an Italian narcoleptic (Rowan Atkinson), a gambler (Jon Lovitz) and a bighearted mom (Whoopi Goldberg). Seth Green(n)

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: An apartment block janitor discovers a magical woman in the swimming pool, who tells him that she has come from a children's fairytale and needs his help to return home. But something dangerous lurks in the woods as the story begins to take over the lives of the characters(n)

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: The people of Covington, a small town in rural Pennsylvania lead peaceful lives, only rarely disturbed by the creatures that inhabit the woods surrounding the village. An agreement has been reached with the creatures and peace prevails under the condition that the boundaries are respected. Yet this balance is disrupted when Lucius Hunt (Joaquin Phoenix), an inquisitive and willful young man, ventures himself beyond the limits of the village. After this, things will never be the same. Written and directed by M. Night Shyamalan, this is his third film after the huge success of The Sixth Sense(n)

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Starring Nicolas Cage, Sam Rockwell and Alison Lohman. Directed by Ridley Scott. Roy, a highly phobic con artist, and his protégé, Frank, are on the verge of pulling off a lucrative swindle when the unexpected arrival of Roy's teenage daughter, Angela, disrupts his carefully ordered life and jeopardizes his high-risk scam(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Bruce Willis returns once again as John McClane, the wisecracking, old-school New York cop whose impressive CV includes rescuing hostages captured in a swanky LA plaza and saving passengers on a hijacked plane circling Washington. In this violent thriller, he's up against a group of terrorists threatening to hack into the US computer infrastructure. When they crash the stock market, sending the economy into meltdown and causing panic on Wall Street, McClane turns to young hacker Matt Farrell. Farrell's wanted by the FBI, but he's also potentially the only man who can help figure out the cyber criminals' next move. When the terrorists respond by kidnapping McClane's daughter Lucy, it's time for the anxious father to load up his ammo clips and go get the bad guys - just as the country's descending into chaos(n)

programme.desc: Classic cult comedy following the adventures of a superannuated Los Angeles hippie who is mistaken for a wealthy industrialist and soon becomes involved in an outlandish extortion scheme. programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Far from seeing eye to eye, Batman and Superman engage in a battle of the ages which plays straight into the hands into Lex Luthor. He unleashes Doomsday who is set to destroy Metropolis, unless Superman and Batman can put aside their differences and defeat the new nemesis with the help of Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
programme.desc: Aided by a young journalist, a woman searches for clues about her mother, who died of cancer in 1951 but not before samples of healthy and cancerous tissues were secretly harvested from her and subsequently used for medical research for decades to come. Based on Rebecca Skloot's best-selling book that took 10 years to research and write(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Jamal Malik is one question away from winning 20 million rupees in the Indian version of the TV quiz show Who Wants to Be A Millionaire?. As he answers correctly one question after another, the producers suspect he is cheating and have him arrested. The police agents questioning him cannot believe that a slumdog like him can have the knowledge to win the prize and become a millionaire overnight. While trying to prove them it is destiny that placed him there, Jamal will take us back to the events of his childhood that have the clue to the answers. We will learn about how he and his little brother strived to survive in the mean streets of Mumbai and how he met Latika, his one true love. He entered the show knowing she would be watching it and now every question brings him closer to her(n)

programme.title: Canelo/Chavez Jr.: A Fighting Tradition
programme.desc: A look at the preparations of these warriors for their May 6 bout in the context of Mexico's great fighting tradition, with Canelo coming from Guadalajara and Chavez from Culiacan. Included are interviews with Oscar De La Hoya and Julio Cesar Chavez Sr(n)

programme.title: 10,000 B.C.

programme.title: Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker
programme.desc: Crisp animation, high-flying action and atmospheric chills distinguish this cartoon adventure. A new, younger Batman (voice of Will Friedle) battles the Joker, who's threatening all of Gotham, with the aging Bruce Wayne his No. 1 target. Along the way, Batman tries to unravel the mystery of what happened the last time the original Batman and the Joker battled. Voices include Mark Hamill(n)

programme.title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2

programme.title: McEnroe/Borg: Fire & Ice

programme.title: Interview With the Vampire
programme.desc: A sombre vampire mesmerises a young reporter with the story of his ghastly transformation from grieving aristocrat to immortal monster, beginning in 18th-century New Orleans with his first encounters with the charismatic and decadent bloodsucker Lestat. programme.title: Introducing the Dwights
programme.desc: An already-unstable household becomes a virtual battle zone when the son of a risqué comedienne and a has-been singer finds mom meddling in his love life in director Cherie Nowlan's dysfunctional romantic comedy. Twenty-one-year-old Tim Dwight (Khan Chittenden) comes from a peculiar family; his mother, Jean (Brenda Blethyn), is a bawdy stage comic renowned for her scatological sense of humor and his father, John (Frankie J. Holden), is a faded country-music star who now works as a low-rent security guard. While dad is busy trying to revive his flat-lined career, mom spends most of her time doting on Tim and his developmentally disabled brother, Mark (Richard Wilson). Upon meeting the beautiful Jill (Emma Booth), Tim believes his may have finally found the woman of his dreams. Unfortunately in Jean's eyes there is only room for one woman in Tim's life, and that woman is his mother. As Tim's relationship with Jill grows increasingly serious, the stage is set for a battle royal between the woman who once gave him life and the prospective mother of his future children(n)

programme.title: Hairspray

John Travolta costars in a well-padded fat suit as her plus-sized mother. Rikki Lake, who starred in Waters' original, has a cameo as a talent agent, and Waters appears as a flasher. Zac Efron, Michelle Pfeiffer, Amanda Bynes(n)

The siege on Rosewood resulted in many deaths, buildings razed to the ground, and surviving residents fleeing in terror. Esther Rolle, Don Cheadle, Elise Neal, Michael Rooker. programme.title: The Last Mimzy
programme.desc: Chris O'Neil and Rhiannon Leigh Wryn star as siblings Noah and Emma Wilder in Bob Shaye's intelligent family sci-fi adventure drama that doesn't talk down to children. While staying at their family beach house near Seattle, the two find a box of things that look like toys, but prove to be far more mysterious. Sent back in time, the 'toys' are trying to pass on a message about the future. And the more Noah and Emma play with the objects from the box, the more their intelligence grows. But one day Noah lines up the toys and accidentally activates a powerful force that creates a state-wide blackout. With her family under arrest by the FBI, Emma must make sense of the messages Mimzy, the toy rabbit, has been telepathically communicating to her(n)

programme.title: Saving My Tomorrow: Kids Who Love the Earth
programme.desc: Children voice their concerns for the environment, the future of the planet and endangered animals in honor of Earth Day. Also: performances and readings by Audra McDonald, Jason Mraz, Karen O and They Might Be Giants(n)

programme.title: Nights in Rodanthe

programme.title: Paradise Road

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club

programme.title: Sleepers

Eleven years after leaving the institution, two of the quartet chance upon their worst tormenter and kill him. Arrested for the crime, they then team up with the two other victims - a reporter and an assistant DA - to contrive a punishment for the rest of the abusers(n)

Along with a state trooper (Joel Edgerton), the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security. Kirsten Dunst, Adam Driver, and Sam Shepard co-star(n)

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: Love crosses international boundaries and makes a big mess en route in this romantic comedy. Carlos Sanchez (Carlos Leon) is from Latin America, and Elena Dubrovnik (Elika Portnoy) is from Russia. Carlos and Elena are in love and living in the United States, but while they'd like to stay, they have a problem -- their visas are soon to expire, and they aren't sure when or if they'll be able to get green cards that will allow them permanent residence. Carlos and Elena are close friends with Mike White (McCaleb Burnett) and Betty Bristol (Ashley Wolfe), who were born and raised in the States. Like Carlos and Elena, Mike and Betty are planning to marry but haven't done so yet, and when they learn of their friends' dilemma, someone comes up with a solution -- Carlos will marry Betty, Mike will marry Elena, and once their respective green cards come through, both couples will divorce and everyone lives happily ever after. However, the plan doesn't go as smoothly as expected -- suspicious immigration agents are keeping a close watch on Carlos and Elena, so the newlyweds have to live with their respective spouses and act happily married in order to maintain the illusion of matrimony, which leads the four friends into a variety of romantic complications. Immigration Tango received its world premiere at the 2010 Boston International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: Wes Anderson's quirky comedy-drama, scripted by Anderson and Owen Wilson (their follow-up to the equally delightful Bottle Rocket), stars Jason Schwartzman as Max Fischer, a scholarship student at the exclusive Rushmore Academy who compensates for his feelings of inadequacy by organising a host of school societies. But when he falls for his teacher, Rosemary Cross, things get messy, and are further complicated when he finds out that she is having an affair with a rich parent, Herman Blume, who happens to be Max's hero and mentor. So begins a battle of wills between Max and Herman..(n)

programme.title: Reagan
programme.desc: Few American presidents have engendered the degree of controversy associated with the 40th, Ronald Wilson Reagan (1911-2004), who held office from 1981-89. Many Americans, especially those on the right, still lionize Reagan as a modern hero, while others passionately argue that the man was merely a figurehead, an "empty suit" surrounded by a vast, whirling Republican political machine. But where does the truth lie? The documentary Reagan enlists such elements as interviews with historians and seldom-seen archival footage to investigate the various element that shaped this undeniably complex and fascinating political icon(n)

programme.desc: Your mind is the scene of the crime. Box-office superstar Leonardo DiCaprio stars in this contemporary science fiction action film set within the architecture of the mind. Shooting in London, Paris, Tangiers, Calgary and Los Angeles, Nolan's mind-bending film also stars Academy Award® winners Michael Caine and Marion Cotillard, in addition to Juno's Ellen Page, Batman Begins' Cillian Murphy and Oscar® nominees Ken Watanabe (The Last Samurai) and Tom Berenger (Platoon)(n)

programme.desc: Peter loses his job as a forklift driver when he keeps pulling stunts at work, and it forces Lois to get an assistant manager job at a shop. Meanwhile, Quagmire and Joe try to provide advice when Lois admits she is tired of Peter's disappointing performances in the bedroom.(n)

programme.title: The Vampire Diaries

programme.title: Margery and Gladys

One-off comedy, starring Penelope Keith, June Brown, Alan David and Marcia Warren.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: An ailing diplomat asks Holmes to retrieve a document about a highly sensitive treaty between Britain and Italy, which an opportunistic thief has stolen from his desk at the Foreign Office. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett, David Burke and David Gwillim.(n)

programme.title: Tales from Northumberland with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor ventures off the beaten track to explore the wilderness of the sparsely populated Northumberland National Park. After spending the night in a ramshackle hut, he meets 23-year-old Emma Grey, who has taken on the challenge of running one of the most remote farms in England. He also visits Kielder Observatory, a labour of love for bricklayer-turned-astronomer Gary Fildes.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team transform the garden of Kathy Mason, a Gloucestershire mother of two who has devoted her life to caring for others. Setting out to recreate the look of an enchanted woodland complete with a summerhouse, the experts plant hundreds of flowers and shrubs and try to shelter the area from the wind, but they end up battling the elements and wading through ankle-deep mud to get the job done.(n)

A culinary rivalry develops between Bert and Mark Bridge, the landlord of the Crab and Lobster pub, at Portwenn Fun Day, with both keen to take advantage of the event by providing food for the spectators.(n)

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are enlisted to design a memorial garden based on the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, but someone begins vandalising their work on a nightly basis. Meanwhile, Steel is forced to confront one of his oldest friends. Guest starring Charles Kay, with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.desc: New sergeant Dennis Merton arrives at Ashfordly police station and soon finds himself embroiled in a CID stakeout - but Ventress's shady past threatens the entire operation. Nostalgic drama, starring William Simons and Duncan Bell.(n)

Starring Gareth Hale, Glynis Barber and Wendy Craig.(n)

programme.desc: The townsfolk are still coming to terms with Sally's death, while Danny and Cady move into Kim's house to make space for the Boothes - leading to a declaration of love. Cathy Saunders' adoption application places Anna on the horns of a dilemma when she realises her friend is addicted to painkillers, and the factory helps out with the children's art fair - albeit in an unusual way.(n)

programme.desc: The actor travels along an idyllic stretch of coastline to find out how Northumberland's past shaped modern Britain. He also follows the `Pilgrims' Way' walking route to Lindisfarne, goes swimming with grey seals at the Farne Islands, and learns how Bamburgh Castle was once the stronghold of the ancient kings of Northumbria.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team head to Woking, Surrey, to transform the garden of John Phillips, a retired serviceman who lost his left arm when a bomb exploded on board HMS Antelope in the Falkland Islands in 1982. The experts plant beds of brightly coloured flowers, a vegetable patch designed to be easily accessible and build a corner seating area, before completing their work with a piece of Falklands rock donated by John's former commanding officer.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.desc: Jessica is embroiled in a grand-scale conspiracy when she investigates the murder of private detective Bernie Callan, whose body was found 30 years after his death in 1963. Joining forces with the dead man's daughter, she discovers the late gumshoe's demise is linked to another high-profile murder from that year - that of US president John F Kennedy. Angela Lansbury stars as the ambitious amateur sleuth.(n)

programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the death of a local aristocrat who seemingly died of a coronary - shortly after declaring he had an important announcement to make. After the peer's will disappears and his lawyer is killed in an arson attack, it is clear sinister forces are at work. However, the prime suspects all appear to have cast-iron alibis. Guest starring Joss Ackland and Sian Phillips, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A respected gynaecologist is accused of sexually assaulting a patient during a routine examination, but Brooks, Devlin and Chandler struggle to find any firm evidence and the team becomes divided. Crown Prosecutor Alesha Phillips refuses to accept defeat and takes on formidable defence barrister Phyllis Gladstone. Crime drama, guest starring Derek Riddell and Lesley Manville, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber, Harriet Walter and Freema Agyeman.(n)

David Jason, Bruce Alexander and Philip Jackson star.(n)

programme.title: Ironside
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the police drama, starring Raymond Burr. The tough San Francisco cop is paralysed in a shooting incident, and determines to track down his assailant from his wheelchair.(n)

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A series of damning reports claims police officers are not playing by the book, so Regan poses as an ex-con and heads to a club frequented by two officers suspected of running a protection racket and taking bribes from villains to release them. John Thaw stars.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.sub-title: Come in T-64, Your Time Is Ticking Away.

However, his partner in the venture is reluctant to involve the police, so he drafts in Terry to act as a driver and help identify the culprits. Needless to say, it soon transpires there is more to the attacks than meets the eye. George Cole, Alfred Burke and Dennis Waterman star.(n)

Comic-strip adventure, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder and Marlon Brando.(n)

Hywel Bennett guest stars, with John Thaw.(n)

programme.desc: Scott Cozens and Sheldon Smithens attend an auction of cars and petrol pumps, but a mint-condition collection of poison bottles also catches their eyes.(n)

programme.desc: Action from the fourth meeting of the season, which was staged at TT Circuit Assen in the Netherlands, and was scheduled to feature two races.(n)

programme.desc: Concerns for Liam's well-being leads to confusion when it is feared he has joined a self-help group, and terrible exam results leave Rob questioning his future. Suspicion surrounds Malcolm's identity and Kenneth is intent on an expose, while Eddie receives the news that his best friend back home has passed away, but nobody seems to be interested.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: The entire precinct's festive holiday celebrations are cut short when officers are called to examine a ruthless homicide linked to Eddie Flores, the deranged nephew of a notable drug lord who has a previous history with Riggs. The season of goodwill is weighing heavily on Riggs however, who flashes back to past Christmases spent in the company of his late wife Miranda. Murtaugh is also a little preoccupied with his neighbour's obnoxious holiday decorations. Action drama based on the film series, starring Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: The Bank Job
programme.desc: A London car dealer is persuaded by an old flame to rob a bank. The heist goes off without a hitch, leaving the crooks in possession of cash and jewels worth millions - as well as a safety deposit box containing top-secret information the government and security services are determined to keep buried. Fact-based crime thriller, starring Jason Statham and Saffron Burrows.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The resourceful barrister defends an Army chaplain accused of murdering his brother. His efforts are not exactly helped by the client's refusal to speak - leaving him to wonder whether he is suffering from shell-shock brought on by a tour of Bosnia or whether he has something to hide. Starring John Thaw, with John Wood, Richard Pasco, Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DI Preston and DS Shaw investigate the theft of a diamond engagement ring, but find the case complicated by an irate wife hell-bent on justice following the hospitalisation of her husband. Acting on information supplied by the woman, officers bring in a suspect, but learn she is engaged to the son of her accuser, who strongly opposes the marriage. Drama, guest starring Diane Keen (Doctors), Georgina Hale (The Bill) and James Sutton (Emmerdale).(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Stafford's daughter warns her father of a planned student demonstration, while one of his colleagues tries to discredit him. Police drama, starring Tim Pigott-Smith.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James plays the stock market and offers Rose financial advice, but Richard is furious to learn she has lost all her money in the crash.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is threatened with demotion and ponders a seemingly perfect job with a security firm, but Nick is suspicious of the lucrative offer. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry, Derek Fowlds and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Lillie
programme.desc: Ambitious parson's daughter Emilie accepts Edward Langtry's proposal, considering him a wealthy man. Costume drama, starring Francesca Annis.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A woman asks Kavanagh to ensure justice is done on behalf of her husband, who died on the operating table in mysterious circumstances - despite the surgeon's claims that he was alive and well when she stitched him up. As if that were not a tough enough assignment, the redoubtable barrister also faces the task of convincing son Matt that failing his A levels is not the end of the world. John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew tries to convince his friend Ronnie Neale that he has a serious illness, an unenviable task at the best of times and one complicated by the prospect of losing Dawn to her estranged husband Keith. Meanwhile, confusion abounds as Sam and Joanna are called out separately to the same patient. Starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Sarah Parish.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A man admits to killing his wife after her body is found by the roadside, but Nick uncovers inconsistencies in the story. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry, Derek Fowlds and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: An investigative journalist makes a programme about the spread of BSE from animals to humans based on a leaked government report. This causes a public uproar and the Force are ordered to seize the documentary.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Sir Richard learns he must sell his home to pay James' considerable debts, and Georgina is heartbroken that there is no money to pay for her wedding. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. While holidaying in Cornwall with his friend Captain Hastings, Poirot meets a local woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play. David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Belgian sleuth's Cornish holiday comes to a dramatic conclusion as he unravels the mystery behind the series of disastrous near-misses that placed the life of a beautiful heiress in danger, and as the truth comes to light, a secret engagement is revealed. David Suchet stars, with Philip Jackson and Hugh Fraser.(n)

programme.title: The Halcyon
programme.desc: Life at the hotel continues as the Blitz rages. Emma finds Joe waiting for her at the staff entrance, remarkably curious about her work for the WVS, while Toby is worried sick after hearing a bomb fell on a shelter in Adil's neighbourhood of Paddington and killed everyone inside. Billy visits the kitchens and tells Dora that he has a job for her, while Lucian offers Lady Hamilton emotional support and Betsey and Sonny have a major altercation. Drama, starring Olivia Williams and Steven Mackintosh.(n)

programme.title: Harlots
programme.desc: Margaret is delighted when Howard offers to be Lucy's keeper, Fanny makes an announcement that could threaten her position in the house, while Nancy is determined to keep Emily Lacey out of Lydia's clutches.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: Albert feels he needs a greater role in public affairs, and becomes involved in the anti-slavery movement. Victoria matches wills with the Duke of Sussex to see that her husband is granted more respect, while Skerrett faces a dilemma when she realises that the only person who can save her cousin and child from certain death is the man she trusts the least.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Second series of the acclaimed crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town. The murder of 11-year-old Danny Latimer rocked Broadchurch, as DI Alec Hardy - still haunted by the collapse of a previous case - was put in charge of the investigation. Many local residents came under suspicion, including the victim's father Mark, before Joe Miller finally gave a lengthy confession, ending weeks of speculation. In this first episode, Miller shocks everyone by pleading not guilty. David Tennant and Olivia Colman star.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The townspeople struggle to come to terms with recent events, and shock waves reverberate through Broadchurch. What will the impact be on the Latimers? Meanwhile, Paul continues his secret meetings and Hardy must face a figure from his past. Meera Syal guest stars in the mystery drama, alongside David Tennant and Olivia Colman.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The beleaguered barrister puts aside his domestic problems to defend a prostitute on the charge of murdering a high-profile businessman - a tricky case made all the more difficult by the discovery that she has many enemies, all of them determined to blacken her character. Drama, starring John Thaw.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: An investigative journalist makes a programme about the spread of BSE from animals to humans based on a leaked government report. This causes a public uproar and the Force are ordered to seize the documentary.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Sir Richard learns he must sell his home to pay James' considerable debts, and Georgina is heartbroken that there is no money to pay for her wedding. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A woman asks Kavanagh to ensure justice is done on behalf of her husband, who died on the operating table in mysterious circumstances - despite the surgeon's claims that he was alive and well when she stitched him up. As if that were not a tough enough assignment, the redoubtable barrister also faces the task of convincing son Matt that failing his A levels is not the end of the world. John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. While holidaying in Cornwall with his friend Captain Hastings, Poirot meets a local woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play. David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star.(n)

programme.title: Lillie
programme.desc: Married life proves dull and when she develops typhoid fever, Lillie convinces Edward to send her to London. Once back in the capital, she soon catches the eye of artists and poets.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A respected Polish-born doctor is prosecuted for his alleged involvement in Nazi war crimes during the Second World War, forcing victims of persecution to relive their harrowing experiences in concentration camps. Kavanagh finds it difficult to remain professionally detached from such an emotive case and discovers that, after 50 years, witness testimony is not always reliable. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Frederick Treves, Warren Mitchell and Peter Firth.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Joanna has to break devastating news to a teenage gymnast, and finds herself thrust into the middle of a family crisis. Drama, starring Haydn Gwynne and Gary Mavers.(n)

programme.desc: Nick discovers an act of courage can have sinister consequences after he rescues a woman from a house fire. Meanwhile, Greengrass sets himself up as a birdwatcher's retreat. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry, Bill Maynard and Derek Fowlds.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: A series of bomb hoax calls by an animal rights group welcome Stafford's return to the force. Police drama, starring Tim Pigott-Smith.(n)

programme.desc: Robert shocks his partner Issy by revealing that he's prepared to pack in work to help look after their new baby, while in her boss's absence, Christine's professional judgement is tested when a burns victim faces almost certain death. With Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant. His anxious wife, believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness, calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: Medical drama about a junior doctor who becomes disillusioned with her life and decides to leave the UK. She heads for South India hoping to make a fresh start, and finds a new home working in an under-resourced and over-worked cottage hospital run by an eccentric English ex-pat. Medical drama, starring Amrita Acharia and Amanda Redman.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Crime drama starring Brenda Blethyn. The detective investigates a fire that rips through a holiday park on the Northumberland coast, destroying three cabins. A young woman's body is discovered and the resort's owner, Jim Viner, fears the victim is his sister Deena when he returns from a weekend away with his daughter Clare. With Jim's suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clare's boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deena's best friend Sally? Co-starring Kenny Doughty, Cush Jumbo and Jon Morrison.(n)

programme.desc: Police in New Mexico are called in to investigate when a woman disappears from a skating rink after meeting a friend.(n)

programme.desc: Rescue workers race to save a couple trapped in a car that crashed down an embankment, but they get a shock when they reach the victims.(n)
