programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates craft beer, meeting a couple who gave up jobs in the NHS to pursue their dream lifestyle of brewing and selling ale. Kate Quilton goes in search of the perfect tomato and finds herself in the middle of the world's biggest food fight at a festival in Valencia, while Matt Tebbutt examines why tinned anchovies taste salty when fresh ones don't, visiting a processing plant to find out.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Horse enthusiast Richard Negus hosts the first dinner party from Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, focusing on a `day at the races' theme. He serves a course called Under Starter's Orders, and They're Off-al for his main course, and provides a game of snail racing for entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business studies lecturer Amber Elba Porter hosts the second dinner party in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, hoping her spiritual-themed evening, complete with tarot card readings and rune stones, will win her the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tim Reinman presents the third dinner party from Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, but is upstaged by domestic goddess Hannah Totman, leaving spiritualist Amber Elba-Porter and hypnotherapist Sue Smith less than happy with their fellow guest. The host hopes his `Timoffee' pie will help to get the night back on track.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sue Smith hosts the fourth dinner party from Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, and decides to organise an evening of entertainment revolving around a `back to school' theme. However, the items on her menu puzzle the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Self-styled domestic goddess Hannah Totman hosts the final dinner party in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, and hopes that her Italian-themed menu and opera singing will impress her guests enough for her to win the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: B&B veteran Paul Workman, who runs Hamlet House in Stratford-upon-Avon, makes the most of his town's Shakespeare connection as another round of the competition gets under way - but his guests cause a fuss when a hair is found in the mushrooms at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to B&B novices Ben Gray and Katie Keegan's Ashlack business in Cumbria. The guests admire rooms in the estate's 17th-century manor house, but Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud are unimpressed when they discover their accommodation is a yurt in the woods. Filled with dread at the idea of a midnight trip to the toilet facilities, they later make plain their feelings when checking out.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Richwood in Torquay, where partners Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud run the 13-bedroom guest house by themselves. The diners are given a crash course in belly-dancing and provided with a feast of Lebanese delicacies - but are soon distracted by the dated decor.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Helen Fraser welcomes her guests to the Tai'r Bull Inn in the Brecon Beacons, with moral support from her friend Kath. Ben and Katie are quick to praise the quality of their lodgings, but B&B veteran Paul spots a few mistakes, while Saida and Veronica refuse to spend the night in their room after they make a discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. A clash then ensues between two of the week's hosts before the winner of the competition is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Famous people explore the British outdoors while taking their four-legged friends for a stroll, beginning with Robert Lindsay, Angela Griffin and Phil Spencer.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Bill Bailey returns to his West Country roots for a walk on Exmoor, Kirsty Wark enjoys the tranquillity of the Isle of Arran and Julian Clary is on the South Downs.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Ben Fogle takes his Labrador along the banks of the Thames, Emma Kennedy and her maltipoo puppy visit the Lake District, and Helen Skelton and her dog are in Dumfries and Galloway.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Phil Spencer takes his cocker spaniels out in Windsor Great Park, Clive Anderson is on the Isle of Mull with his terrier and Katy Brand is in Constable country with her dog.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: An elephant calf is born at Chester Zoo, but its young half-sister doesn't welcome the new arrival. Meanwhile, Bush dog dad Franco is under pressure as its family grows, and an onager - a rare type of wild horse - faces a major operation.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Abroad
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to view the result of Nicky and James Dobree's project to convert a traditional farmhouse into a luxurious eight-bedroom chalet in the Alpine ski resort of Les Gets, France. With the owners busy back in London, the builders initially struggled to interpret the plans for a structure unlike anything they had seen before - but two years later, the work is complete.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, with clips and reactions to programmes from people not around to watch them at the time. This edition focuses on the time of revolution on the small screen in the 80s, including men co-habiting with sea lions, gay men and women coming out on TV, and monkeys playing tennis on ice.(n)

programme.title: The 80s: Ten Years That Changed Britain
programme.desc: A look back at British society and pop culture in the 1980s. The programme looks back at iconic elements of the decade, including alternative comedy, football hooliganism, the Falklands war, Red Wedge, New Romanticism, Acid House and the divisive government of Margaret Thatcher. With contributions from Tony Hadley, Martin Kemp, Richard Branson, Ridley Scott, Katharine Hamnett, Alexei Sayle, Marc Almond, Lynne Franks, Adam Ant, Ken Livingstone and Julian Clary.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits PJ's Steakhouse in Queens, New York, to provide his expert advice to the owners. They decided to turn a successful bar into a high-end restaurant, but without any previous experience in managing a business they have found themselves seriously in debt. With an over-confident chef and a partner propping up the bar, co-owner Madalyn faces a few difficult decisions.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Florida to help the owners of Fleming, a Danish restaurant in Miami. A husband-and-wife duo bought the business eight years ago in the hope of continuing the place's success, but started losing money rapidly. With a Cuban chef cooking Nordic cuisine and a filthy kitchen, things go from bad to worse until it all comes to a head on relaunch night.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, with clips and reactions to programmes from people not around to watch them at the time. This edition focuses on the time of revolution on the small screen in the 80s, including men co-habiting with sea lions, gay men and women coming out on TV, and monkeys playing tennis on ice.(n)

programme.title: Big Fat Gypsy Weddings
programme.desc: First episode of the documentary series that explores the often extravagant and surprising world of gypsies and travellers in Britain, focusing on rite-of-passage celebrations to reveal the community's attitudes toward gender roles, education and outsiders. It begins with a look at the milestones in a gypsy girl's life, highlighting an eight-year-old's First Holy Communion and the spectacular wedding of a couple who met four months previously.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Adrian Simpson meets London couple Bob and Annette Roberts, who want a retirement holiday home in Grenada, so he searches the Caribbean island for properties on a budget of £225,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Adrian Simpson shows Deborah and Peter Merritt a selection of properties for sale in Tobago. The couple downsized in the UK, and have decided to invest £300,000 in a holiday home on the breathtaking Caribbean island close to Trinidad.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the contemporary Fraoch House in Edinburgh, where Gareth Houston and his mother Heather Davidson hope to impress the guests with their stylish interiors and modern approach to hospitality.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: A pair of newlywed B&B owners invite their rivals to a traditional establishment in Marple, Greater Manchester, hoping its quaint location will be enough to secure the prize. However, the guests soon make it abundantly clear that it will take more than an idyllic setting to fulfil their expectations.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Suzy Way, the owner of a modern and unconventional B&B near Loughborough, Leicestershire, and her sister Niki Brown prepare an activity-packed day featuring water sport wakeboarding and a home-made curry to win their guests over.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: John Benson is the last to host the group at his B&B in Braintree, Essex, where he hopes his strong business sense and capable manager will make a good impression. A day out at a skidpan track is not to everyone's liking, but dinner is a more relaxed affair, enhanced by spooky stories and a sing-song.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners discover what the other competitors think of their businesses by opening the cash-filled envelopes, which contain what their rivals believe their hosts should receive. They meet for one last time to learn who has won the best value B&B of the week.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Adrian Simpson meets Colin and Veronica Moore, who want a holiday home in St Lucia where they can escape the British winters, so he searches the Caribbean island for properties on a budget of £200,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows Jill and Philip Hefford a selection of properties that fall within their £125,000 budget in Clearwater, Florida, where the couple want to buy a decent-sized home for Philip's daughter that can double-up as a winter-time holiday home for themselves.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Property magnate Paul Whight invites Tony Robinson and the team to investigate his stately home in Essex to learn more about the De Veres, better known as the Earls of Oxford, who once lived there. In an in-depth search of the building and garden, the archaeologists gradually make discoveries that shed light on the history of the home and the aristocratic family.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians travel to Nottinghamshire, where residents of Clipstone village near Sherwood Forest believe some impressive ruins in a farmer's field may have played a part in the ancient tales of Robin Hood and Bad King John. The extensive building records and high-quality carvings prove a fine building existed somewhere nearby, but finding out what it looked like and how large it was frustrates the archaeologists.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Documentary following life at Scott Miller's veterinary practice in Richmond Hill, south-west London, beginning as he tends a cat that has fallen three floors.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Elderly one-eyed South African porcupine Roxy is introduced to a new, younger male called Henning, in the hope that she will find companionship in her old age. Kifaru, the oldest eastern black rhino at Chester Zoo, meets younger female Malindi, with the expectation that they will produce offspring to increase the dwindling population, while the Caribbean flamingos are breeding again.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Revisited
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to rural Wales to visit Andrew and Lowri Davies, who dreamed of replacing their cramped cottage with an environmentally friendly farmhouse built using state-of-the-art eco materials. The couple needed to reduce their mortgage and work to a strict budget - but after an argument with the architect, they found it increasingly difficult to balance the books.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three Hampshire homeowners seek inspiration in each other's houses, then have a week and £1,500 to make changes before buyer Isla and her mum Samia turn up for a viewing.(n)

programme.title: Million Pound Movers
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the high-end removals industry in the UK, meeting the wealthy clients moving priceless objects, and the firms tasked with completing the precarious jobs. Art enthusiast Beverly is moving out of her 33-room manor house near Bath, with her collection of antiques needing to be carefully taken with her, while interior designer Yvette is transferring to a rented Chelsea townhouse with the hope of finding love. The Jacobsen family aim to set up a vineyard on an 80-acre countryside estate, and art collector Dora and new husband Nick have a delicate portrait of President Obama to move into their first home together in north-west London.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Seventy-five-year-old Gerry is rushed to A&E with a dangerously high heart rate of over 250bpm, and doctors suspect an underlying chest infection is the cause. Meanwhile, 92-year-old Margaret arrives at St George's after falling over and hitting her head, and six-year-old Daniel is treated for an infected blister on his foot.(n)

programme.desc: Giant Swamp Rats. In wetlands around the United States, an invader is taking over. Slowly spreading further north with each year and multiplying at an unbelievable rate, these invasive creatures are laying waste to entire acres of plant life, destroying fragile ecosystems and driving out native wildlife. Say hello to nutria, one of America's most destructive invasive species. Join Nat Geo WILD for an exclusive look at nutria and their impact around the United States. From their native habitat in Argentina to the swamps of Louisiana, marshes of Maryland, and even the city of Portland, Oregon, we follow biologists who are going to extreme lengths to curb the infestation and save our wetlands and native wildlife from the invasive nutria(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Bang the Drum Ashley. Will (Will Smith) is both amazed and distressed by how his cousins' leisure activities are so meticulously dictated and scheduled by his control-freak Uncle Philip (James Avery). Aware that cousin Ashley (Tatyana M. Ali) is unhappy over being forced to take violin lessons, Will convinces her to trade her fiddle for a set of drums. Naturally, Phillip is outraged, but Aunt Vivian (Janet Hubert-Whitten) is supportive of Will's actions--at least until Ashley announces that she plans to give up her ballet lessons as well. This episode marks the first appearance of Will's best friend Jazz (Jeff Townes)--not to mention the first time that Jazz is unceremoniously booted out of the Banks mansion by a fed-up Philip!(n)

Terrified of "Dr. No", Will turns to cousin Carlton (Alfonso Ribeiro) for advice on how to win over the girl's dad. programme.desc: Jesse's Girl. In flashback, the girls find out why Jesse (John Stamos) seems poised to do great bodily harm to Joey (David Coulier). It all began when Jesse brought home his latest girlfriend Corinna (Elizabeth Keifer), ostensibly to give her guitar lessons. Alas, Jesse gets a harsh lesson of his own when Corinna demonstrates a decided preference for Joey--especially when he delivers an extemporaneous one-man reenactment of "The Wizard of Oz". Ross (David Schwimmer) insists that he's "fine" concerning the romance between Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) and Joey (Matt LeBlanc), but proves otherwise when he gets drunk during a dinner date. Complicating matters is the confused state of mind of Ross' erstwhile girlfriend Charlie (Aisha Tyler). Meanwhile, Phoebe's half-brother, Frank Jr. (Giovanni Ribisi), pays a visit with the triplets borne by surrogate mom Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) in tow, the better to make a curious offer. programme.title: The Fighting Temptations
programme.desc: Cuba Gooding Jr plays a New York executive down on his luck who finds out he's been left $150,000 by his aunt Sally. Returning to his hometown in Georgia, he discovers there's a catch: he has to create a gospel choir capable of winning the Gospel Explosion competition. Recruiting the town's one decent singer, he assembles a mish-mash of singers, including local convicts, and sets about getting them into shape. The conclusion of Jonathan (Nuns on the Run, My Cousin Vinny) Lynn's film is never in any doubt but Gooding Jr's role as the sophisticated fish-out-of-water executive is played with panache and the musical numbers punctuating the film are performed with suitable gusto(n)

programme.title: Sabrina the Teenage Witch
programme.desc: Salem loses Sabrina and her aunts in a card game against a fiendishly clever player whose luck seems too good to be true. Supernatural sitcom, starring Melissa Joan Hart.(n)

programme.title: 4 O'Clock Club
programme.desc: Josh and the gang are accidentally picked for Mr Nunn's cross-country team, and Mr Bell is suspicious when his new statue gets damaged.(n)

programme.title: news2day
programme.desc: Domestic and international news items of interest to younger viewers.(n)

programme.title: Marvel Avengers Assemble
programme.desc: The Avengers reunite when Captain America and Iron Man learn to appreciate their differences while trying to save the world from ultimate destruction at Ultron's hands.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall embarks on a global journey, beginning in the Arctic where he boards an ice-breaker and goes in search of a polar bear.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Bart perform street magic in a bid to impress passers-by and raise enough cash to pay a mechanic's bill. Unfortunately, they quickly realise people are suckers for a sob story, and start conning the public for money. Featuring the guest voice of Edward Norton.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: An accident at the Backpackers lands David in trouble and in need of help. After arriving home from a night shift, Steph suspects that Sonya has succumbed to temptation.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Phoebe seeks solace in alcohol, VJ questions his parenting ability after seeing Luc with Irene, and Olivia has reservations when Hunter suggests they move in together.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things to Know About
programme.desc: Aoibhinn Ni Shuilleabhain, Kathriona Devereux and Jonathan McCrea examines the science behind the workings of the human brain, with Jonathan undergoing an MRI scan to reveal the structures and activity going on in his. The team learns how the country's researchers are working to tackle neurological conditions, while 2FM DJ Rick O'Shea discusses what it's like to live with epilepsy. In Weird Science, Fergus McAuliffe explores what scientists have learned from studying a remote tribe in Papua New Guinea who eat human brains.(n)

programme.title: Follow Donal
programme.desc: Donal Skehan creates three dishes inspired by Sweden, Italy and Poland, including beetroot gravadlax with crisp bread, and hazelnut vodka butterscotch pudding.(n)

programme.title: The Taste of Success
programme.desc: Four contenders are set to get the chop as the latest search to find a new Irish food product continues, but it remains to be seen who will go through to the next round.(n)

programme.title: Restoration Home
programme.desc: Caroline Quentin meets Hayley and Alan, who bought a derelict 19th-century chapel in south Wales for £25,000. They hoped to transform the vestry into a spacious three-bedroom home and then get a mortgage to restore the whole building, but the scope of the task and the tightness of their £20,000 budget soon hits home. The historical investigation charts the rise and importance of chapels such as this and how an act passed in the 17th century would fundamentally change the fortunes of worshippers.(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: In an episode directed by actress Ellen Pompeo (Meredith), Diane Pierce's health deteriorates, but the doctors disagree over her treatment. Richard copes with Bailey's betrayal.(n)

programme.sub-title: Trolled, Sextorted and Hours From Death.
programme.desc: The presenter shines a light on the impact of online bullying, grooming, phishing, catfishing and scamming. She also meets cyber-victims who have been trolled to the point of suicidal depression.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: The Truth About Magaluf: Stacey Dooley Investigates.
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley travels to Magaluf, on the Spanish island of Majorca, to discover how its reputation as a holiday and party destination affects the people who live and work there. While putting in some hours behind a bar, she is surprised at the amount of free alcohol young tourists are given, and the explicit drinking games they are encouraged to play. Later, she discovers that the emergency services have seen more deaths in the past year than ever before, thanks in part to a craze called balconing - the act of jumping from a balcony into a pool.(n)

programme.desc: One-off documentary set in a south London auction house, which specialises in lost property, repossessed goods and house clearances, meeting some of the eager visitors who dream of finding the one item that will transform them into millionaires. Richie has been playing the game for the past decade. At a pre-auction viewing he has spotted what he thinks is a priceless Japanese print. Toni is rebuilding her life after a devastating illness, hoping to become a dealer of high-end merchandise. Auction addict Sharon gave up her steady job to become a professional trader. Will any of them bag the bargain of a lifetime?.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Church minister John Humberstone has been welcoming guests to the Grade-II listed Alexandra Hotel in Llandudno for the past couple of years, but the business is in deep trouble. Alex Polizzi heads to north Wales to try to revive the establishment's fortunes, but has her work cut out to transform its failing restaurant, bad reputation and negative reviews.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: Cameras follow the flying doctors and paramedics of the Yorkshire Air Ambulance. A boy suffers a fractured skull after falling through a roof, and wintry weather causes problems.(n)

programme.title: Nurses Who Kill
programme.desc: The chilling story of German nurse Stephan Letter, who was tried for the murders of 29 patients, later stating that he acted to spare their suffering.(n)

programme.title: Cold Justice
programme.desc: Kelly Siegler and Yolanda McClary revisit the cold case of Alma Henderson, who went missing in April 1988 after visiting a club with some friends. A few days later the former beauty queen's car was found in a hotel parking lot with her body inside. She was naked, appeared to have been sexually assaulted and was shot in the head.(n)

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: In March 2007, Brian Lewis murdered Hayley Jones - his partner and the mother of his four children - by stabbing her with a kitchen knife as she slept. The couple had drifted apart after Lewis lost his job and he became increasingly suspicious of her online activities, with the final straw for him coming when she changed her status to `single' on a social-networking site. This programme uses dramatic reconstruction to chart the key events in the case, using witness testimony, crime reports, forensic evidence and expert commentary.(n)

programme.title: Del Boys & Dealers
programme.sub-title: Wheelers, Dealers and Del Boys: `Luvvly Jubbly'.
programme.desc: Documentary following the real-life wheeler-dealers who scour auction houses, car-boot sales and junk shops, dreaming of finding that precious item that will one day transform them into millionaires. The film introduces London couple Richie and Nikki, who have been at the auction game for the past decade and specialise in gold, and Pontypridd man Ieuan, who strikes it lucky at a sale when he is the only buyer to recognise a Rolex watch. At least, that's what he thinks it is. There's also the story of Essex husband and wife Al and Sharon, who gave up work to become full-time dealers and now recycle old items to sell on. But their home is getting overrun with stock.(n)

programme.title: The Other Side
programme.desc: The team members visit the Western Development Museum in Saskatchewan where they encounter the spirit of a young boy who is longing to find his parents, while being tormented by a paranormal bully.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: In Missouri, the ghost hunters investigate a former old people's home and orphanage with over 10,000 reported deaths. Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin uncover horrifying tales of the Odd Fellow's Asylum secret society, which used human remains for their dark rituals.(n)

programme.title: Secret Eaters
programme.desc: Anna Richardson helps a couple from Farnborough in Hampshire solve the puzzle of why they keep putting on weight. Ronnie Derrett insists she mostly cooks fresh meals, while fiance Stuart Ellaway believes he eats a healthy, balanced diet. Will 24 hours of snacking surveillance provide the eye-opener they need to make them change their eating habits for good? Plus, the theory that the shape of the glass a person drinks from affects their weight.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Swansea.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Swansea to meet 15-year-old Jack, who suffers from a rare form of muscular dystrophy that has led to a lifetime of painful operations. His mother Helen and older brother Daniel do all they can to help but as he grows it has become impossible to get him upstairs and now he has to sleep in the living room, leaving the rest of the family with nowhere to socialise. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their three-bedroom semi, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, revealing what makes its officers tick, how they deal with the tragedies they inevitably have to face and how much they rely on each other and also their camaraderie.(n)

programme.title: World's Fattest Man
programme.desc: Paul Mason searches for a surgeon to remove the excess skin his 700lb weight loss left him with, and finds love on the way.(n)

programme.title: Nurses Who Kill
programme.desc: The case of dialysis nurse Kimberly Clark Saenz, who poisoned patients by injecting bleach into their bloodstream.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A world-renowned photographer is killed while visiting Hawaii to take pictures for a sports magazine's annual swimsuit edition. Several suspects are in the frame - while Danno is first in line to interview the shocked models. Starring Scott Caan.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Ua Hiki Mai Kapalena Pau (Until the End Is Near).
programme.desc: McGarrett and the team believe they are closing in on Wo Fat with the help of information provided by Agent Jenna Kaye. Unfortunately, Danny is exposed to a lethal neurological agent during a raid, raising fears that someone on the island may be preparing a bioterrorist attack.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Jim and Alison travel to Cancun in Mexico to collect a three-year-old chimp named Bryan, who has been mistreated by his owner. An adult chimp is suffering at the hands of the same keeper, and Alison endeavours to persuade the authorities to help her rescue this animal as well.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Bryan settles into his new home after a long journey from Mexico and one of his first tasks is to learn how to peel fruit. Fellow chimp Joline raises concerns when it is revealed she is suffering from aching joints, hair loss and a lack of appetite. Medical tests prove inconclusive so she is sent for exploratory surgery.(n)

programme.title: It's Me or the Dog
programme.desc: Victoria Stilwell attempts to curb the aggressive behaviour of a miniature dachshund. The dog has a particular hatred for small children and goes wild at the sight of a pushchair. Its owner's cat is also on the receiving end, but the animal expert is determined to bring the disruptive pet to heel.(n)

programme.title: It's Me or the Dog
programme.desc: Animal behaviour expert Victoria Stilwell is called in to help discipline a jealous, fiercely possessive Yorkshire terrier that regards itself as the man of the house, and attacks its long-suffering owner whenever he goes near his partner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team tries to exonerate McGarrett, who is in prison awaiting trial for the murder of the Governor, and the discovery of a hidden camera could prove to be vital in their quest. Meanwhile, Kono is suspended from HPD pending further investigation into allegations of evidence forfeiture. Starring Alex O'Loughlin.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A 15-year-old paddleboarder is abducted, and the team faces a race against time to find her as she is not carrying medication for a heart condition. Meanwhile, Governor Denning introduces a new recruit, who is given the task of making sure her colleagues abide by the new rules. Captain Vince Fryer from Internal Affairs interrogates Kono and reaches an unpopular view on her career in the force.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and his comrades look into the murder of a dodgy US Navy contractor involved in the illegal transactions of confidential data. Alarm bells ring when the investigation reveals that one of their own has been compromised. The outlook isn't sunny for Hetty, either, who comes under attack from the Department of Justice. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell, LL Cool J and Linda Hunt.(n)

programme.title: Haven
programme.desc: FBI agent Audrey Parker arrives in the small town of Haven, Maine, to solve the murder of a local ex-con, only to learn the community is home to people with supernatural powers. First episode of the crime drama, starring Emily Rose, Lucas Bryant, Eric Balfour and Nicholas Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The calamity-prone group visits a guest ranch where Mitch and Cam hope to rediscover their macho side, and a cowboy named Hank takes an instant shine to Gloria. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam try to get Lily on their side when they decide to adopt a baby boy, but have doubts about whether they are adequately prepared to raise another child. Meanwhile, Gloria deals with Manny's head teacher.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the sci-fi animation series from the makers of The Simpsons, charting the adventures of a pizza-delivery boy cryonically frozen and woken in the year 3000. Fry meets a cyclops named Leela, alcoholic robot Bender and his own future nephew Professor Farnsworth. Featuring the guest voices of Dick Clark and Leonard Nimoy.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge receives a jail sentence for child neglect and while prison serves as a welcome break from her hectic home life, Homer struggles to hold the fort in her absence.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Sideshow Bob escapes from jail on a mission to destroy television for good, and holds Springfield to ransom with a stolen nuclear warhead. Featuring the guest voices of Kelsey Grammer and R Lee Ermey.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge goes on the offensive and plans a protest against a combat sport that has captivated Springfield's male population. When promoter Chett Englebrecht hears of her campaign, he challenges her to a fight - and agrees to shut down his entire operation if she beats him.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Freemasons
programme.desc: The most powerful of all Masonic rituals comes under the spotlight as cameras continue their unprecedented look at what it means to be a Freemason today.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan Thinking Aloud
programme.desc: The comedian examines the difference between an underdog and a loser as he explores how he thinks British people see themselves.(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own US Road Trip
programme.desc: James Corden invites Jamie Redknapp, Jack Whitehall and Andrew Flintoff to take part in an adventure across America and compete in a series of challenges, with the overall loser having to strip on stage with the Chippendales. In the first edition, the jet-lagged boys land in California and hit the bowling alley, before taking to the field in front of a packed-out crowd at an Oakland Raiders game for a field-goal kicking competition. Finally, they must brave the freezing, shark-infested waters surrounding Alcatraz Island to swim all the way back to San Francisco Bay.(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own

programme.title: Revolution

programme.title: Arrow

When Oliver hears Larvan has broken free, and is threatening the lives of his friends, he turns to a surprising ally for help. Superhero adventure, guest starring Emily Kinney.(n)

programme.title: Animal House
programme.desc: Documentary series shining a spotlight on the staff at SPCA Auckland, who dedicate their days to the care and protection of the region's animals. From an injured penguin in need of first aid, to a litter of kittens trapped inside a wall, these compassionate professionals are committed to the rescue, rehabilitation, and adoption of animals in distress.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Jim comes to the aid of Charlie, who is being picked on by the other males in the group. Bryan the chimp meets his foster mother, Sally, but the team is unsure how he will cope.(n)

programme.desc: DJ `Diddy' David Hamilton receives help from animal behaviour expert Victoria Stilwell. His unhygienic Gordon setter Max is in desperate need of discipline to counteract its all-consuming obsession with bright lights, reflections and shiny objects.(n)

programme.title: Forever
programme.desc: Supernatural drama, starring Ioan Gruffudd as New York medical examiner Henry Morgan, who has an extraordinary secret - he's immortal. He's spent the past 200 years dying and springing back to life, yet he doesn't understand why, and having had to watch a string of friends, family and lovers die while he lives on, he is determined to understand the mystery of his existence. In the first episode, Detective Jo Martinez comes snooping to figure out why a deadly train crash - one in which Henry was `killed' - took place. Co-starring Judd Hirsch and Alana De La Garza.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and his colleagues learn that a figure from the past has set their sights on a member of the team - and all the intelligence points to Hetty being the intended target. Meanwhile, Nell experiences difficulty handling herself, having killed for the first time, so receives counselling from psychologist Nate Getz. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell, with Linda Hunt, Renee Felice Smith and Peter Cambor.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the death of Navy Seal member Max Garcia after Joe White raises suspicions about the original verdict of suicide. Meanwhile, Chin Ho grows concerned about the company Kono has been keeping since being kicked off the force. Guest starring William Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team takes to the water when a deep-sea diver is found dead and faces the task of breaking the news to the victim's mother, who has Alzheimer's. Guest starring Patty Duke (The Miracle Worker) and Peter Fonda (Easy Rider).(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and the gang take decisive action to protect one of their own while being interrogated by the Department of Justice. It looks like trouble is in store when NCIS director Leon Vance also puts in an appearance - and true to form he has disturbing news for Hetty.(n)

programme.title: Haven
programme.desc: Audrey tries to settle in as a new police officer in town, and she is joined by Nathan to investigate the seemingly random destruction of a local bar.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam and Mitch go on diets, and Phil is inspired to try his hand at tightrope walking. Meanwhile, Claire tries to plant ideas in the heads of her warring daughters, and Jay's behaviour grates on Gloria.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay helps Manny with a school fundraiser involving lots of wrapping paper, and Claire petitions for a stop sign at a busy junction. Meanwhile, Mitchell is determined to prove a point to Cameron, but neither of them will back down. American comedy, guest starring David Cross (Arrested Development), with Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fry pays his first visit to the moon, and persuades Leela to accompany him on an expedition in search of the original lunar landing site - but their excursion soon turns into a life-or-death drama.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart uses industrial adhesive to stick assorted novelty items to his face, while Lisa persuades Homer to let her visit the museum - but takes the wrong bus and becomes lost in an unfamiliar part of Springfield.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family hears about Grampa's time in the Air Force, and when Milhouse's Dutch cousin Annika pops by, Bart takes up smoking to impress her. Featuring the guest voice of Game of Thrones' Carice van Houten.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Strong men are left quaking by the news that alcohol has been made illegal in Springfield. Luckily salvation is at hand in the form of prohibition-busting bootlegger Homer, who brews his own beer to meet demand. Featuring the guest voice of Joe Mantegna.(n)

programme.title: Supergirl
programme.desc: Lena's ex-boyfriend Jack Spheer comes to National City to unveil his big breakthrough in nanotechnology, but Kara's questions about his discovery end up putting everyone in danger.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Barry travels to 2024 in the hope of saving Iris by discovering Savitar's identity and encounters future versions of his friends. Meanwhile, the hunt for Killer Frost continues.(n)

programme.title: Searching for Madeleine
programme.desc: Martin Brunt reveals the damning findings of a secret Home Office report into the police inquiry into the disappearance of Madeleine McCann in May 2007.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and Danny finally track down the missing uranium, which has been used to build a bomb. Now, they must carefully extract the unstable explosive through treacherous terrain.(n)

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.sub-title: Lost in a Space That Isn't There.
programme.desc: Dylan suspects there is a mole among the crew, and his investigations lead him to believe the Abyss has somehow infected Beka. Sci-fi adventure, starring Kevin Sorbo and Lisa Ryder.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.desc: The captain of a luxury yacht sails into problems near Vancouver Island, and suspicions are raised about a doggedly determined driver in Alberta.(n)

programme.desc: The leader of a group of Delvians tricks the crew of Moya into visiting her temple, where she plans to rob Zhaan of her powers. Sci-fi adventure, starring Ben Browder and Virginia Hey.(n)

programme.desc: The search for the Ruby Chalice of Truth continues as Sydney and Nigel enrol in a French cookery school, determined to fulfil Professor Chandler's life-long mission. Tia Carrere and Christien Anholt star.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp's Britain
programme.desc: The actor explores the nation's drinking habits, looking at the impact of alcohol on the individual as well as society as a whole. Ross's investigation starts on call with a paramedic in Sunderland as he examines what the UK's drink-obsessed culture is costing the ambulance services, hospitals and the police, and also learns the price of social drinking when he meets those whose habits have cost them their friends, family and almost their live.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: August arrives and the fishermen of Brixham spend time ashore with their families as their boats are repaired - but summer proves costly for Jan, who loses £1,000 for every day his vessel is out of action. Apprentice deckhand Logan has to decide whether a life at sea is the right choice for him and his family, and seafood seller Jenny receives a surprise on her 65th birthday.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britain's grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A detective from Danny's precinct is killed while working undercover and Frank holds a press conference to help find the culprit, but later discovers that the officer was hiding a dark secret. Elsewhere, Jamie and Eddie help Nicky track down a former classmate who is living on the streets. Starring Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Sam and Josh conspire to keep a controversial sex education report secret until after mid-term elections, and the president prepares to sign the Hate Crimes bill amidst concern that the parents of a murdered gay student will attend the ceremony. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet faces a dilemma over whether to offer a reprieve to a death row inmate, and turns to a priest for guidance. Meanwhile, a feisty campaign manager begs for an audience with the beleaguered leader. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Karl Malden.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The discovery of human remains outside a former state penal facility prompts the team to reopen a case from 1968, when an inmate was murdered on the night of Johnny Cash's Folsom Prison concert.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The maternity ward is closed when two babies display mystery symptoms, including high temperatures and seizures. House horrifies the doctors by partially suspending treatment in a bid to determine whether drugs are exacerbating the problem - and when a baby boy dies, Cameron breaks down and is forced to confront a trauma in her past. House carries out an autopsy on the boy in a final attempt to identify the virus.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny is placed on desk duty after investigating a case that was off-limits, and realises he has stumbled upon something that someone within the NYPD was trying very hard to hide. He passes the information on to Frank, who is alarmed when he discovers the enormity and corrupt nature of the situation.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former British ambassador to the USA presents a guide to the forces that drive New York City, and examines the importance of money, faith and fashion in the Big Apple. He also meets several of the city's luminaries, including broadcaster Barbara Walters, mayor Michael Bloomberg, hedge fund manager Richard Hurowitz and Bruce Upbin, managing editor of business journal Forbes Magazine.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Sam and Toby are sent to Connecticut to secure the release of President Bartlet's choice for the Supreme Court, and Josh visits a college to talk about working in the White House. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: A film bigwig in LA tries to blackmail the President by threatening to cancel a fundraising bash unless he advocates the inclusion of homosexuals in the military. Meanwhile, Josh is thrilled to learn feisty campaign manager Joey Lucas is staying in his hotel. David Hasselhoff and Jay Leno guest star.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush reopens the investigation into the murder of two Cambodian illegal immigrants who were shot dead in their apartment. The couple's bodies were found by their six-year-old daughter, now a teenager, who has discovered a bracelet once owned by her mother is for sale on the internet.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctor is unsympathetic when a nun is admitted to the clinic amid claims her symptoms are consistent with stigmata. He believes her swollen, raw hands are the result of an allergy, but is forced to rethink his diagnosis when she suffers an adverse reaction to the medication he prescribes. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The police drama starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg returns, with Danny tracking down a cartel after he and Baez come under attack as they escort confiscated drugs to be incinerated at a remote location. Elsewhere, Frank must deal with personal and political issues when a lieutenant's actions cause controversy for the NYPD.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Trump's America
programme.desc: As President Trump reaches 100 days in office, Sky's US Correspondents travel across America asking people to describe how their lives have changed under Donald Trump.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The fate of Jon Snow is revealed, Ramsay sends his dogs after Theon and Sansa, while Ellaria and the Sand Snakes make their move.(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard locks horns with Dinesh when his success goes to his head. Meanwhile, Erlich's interest is piqued by Jian-Yang's new app.(n)

programme.title: Real Time with Bill Maher
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Maher invites three guests from different parts of the political spectrum to discuss the week's events.(n)

programme.title: Captivated: The Trials of Pamela Smart
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the impact of America's first fully televised court case. In 1991, Pamela Smart stood trial for persuading her teenage lover and his friends to murder her husband. The film re-examines the details of the case, charting its influence on American culture over the past 20 years and how the unprecedented media attention may have influenced the outcome.(n)

programme.title: Banshee
programme.desc: Proctor, Rebecca, and Burton join forces to take down the Black Beards in a bloody showdown in Philadelphia. Drama, starring Antony Starr.(n)

programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: After her argument with Hannah, Marnie follows through on her threat to find another apartment and moves in with a delighted Shoshanna. Jessa texts everyone inviting them to a party, which turns out to be not quite what they expected, while Hannah offers the spare room to her gay ex-boyfriend Elijah, upsetting Adam - who had hoped to take their relationship to the next level.(n)

programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: The return of the comedy following the exploits of four twenty-something Brooklyn women. Hannah has a new flatmate and is in a relationship, but is still unable to cut ex-boyfriend Adam out of her life. As things go downhill for Marnie, her mother pays a visit, while Jessa returns from honeymoon and Shoshanna tries to avoid Ray. Starring Lena Dunham, Allison Williams, Zosia Mamet and Jemima Kirke.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In the final programme, he discovers how earthquakes wreak so much havoc.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Life in the Devon fishing port of Brixham. Spring is in the air, and the town is a hive of activity as skippers return their pleasure yachts to the water after winter in the dry dock, while the pressure is on for Brixham to look its best for the arrival of Princess Anne, who will officially open the new £20million fish market, and the start of the summer season.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Everyday life at Northumberland's Chillingham Castle, where the members of staff try to tactfully deal with the whims of their employer, baronet Humphry Wakefield, as the estate prepares to welcome a band of ghost-hunting tourists. Meanwhile, Carlton Towers in East Yorkshire hosts an annual dog show for Afghan hounds.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Fitzalan Howard try to impress American guests at Carlton Towers with a programme of traditional activities, including skinning rabbits and taking high tea. Meanwhile, Sir Humphry Wakefield entertains tourists on a wine-tasting weekend at Chillingham Castle.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: The Penningtons, owners of Muncaster Castle in the Lake District, discuss the challenges of housing three generations of their family under one roof, while elderly patriarch Patrick struggles to find new purpose following the death of his wife. At Maunsel House in Somerset, Sir Benjamin Slade's preconceptions are challenged when a gay men's choir arrives for a weekend break.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat investigates the balance of power in Rome and discovers how the city has been affected by the end of Silvio Berlusconi's government. He also explores the influence of organised crime in the Italian capital and speaks to journalist Myrta Merlino, fashion designer and politician Santo Versace and Pietro Grasso, the head of the city's anti-Mafia crime unit.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The president comes under pressure to appoint a successor to the late Chairman of the Federal Reserve, while the Secret Service grow concerned about hate mail regarding Zoey's relationship with Charlie. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Zoey attends a college party, where one of her friends is arrested for using drugs. As CJ struggles to keep the story out of the papers, Josh meets the administration's controversial nominee for assistant attorney general and Sam clashes with Mallory over private school vouchers. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush reopens the case of a 12-year-old girl found dead at a local swimming hole when a woman is murdered and dumped at the same spot bearing similar markings on her body. The team discovers the first victim was bullied by classmates who invited her to a sleepover on the night of her death.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctor treats a schizophrenic woman admitted with a pulmonary embolism, but soon realises there must be more to her case when she starts bleeding excessively. He finds a tumour on the patient's liver which could explain the blood, but refuses to give up on his theory that the original diagnosis of mental illness was incorrect - and Chase's solution to the puzzle could change the woman's life for ever. Medical mystery drama, starring Hugh Laurie and Jesse Spencer.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A fellow officer is ostracised by her colleagues for testifying against her partner, so when Jamie offers support and volunteers to assist her for a week, he faces the wrath of the other officers. Danny and Erin clash when a settled case is reopened as a murder investigation. Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan and Will Estes star.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough employs the latest technologies to explore the violence, rivalries and deadly weaponry existing within the world of bugs. programme.title: What About Bob
programme.desc: A psychiatrist takes on a friend's client, who turns out to be a well-meaning but annoying neurotic barely able to leave his home. The patient is hugely impressed by the consultant's methods, leading him to follow the therapist on holiday, where he unwittingly proceeds to make his life hell while winning over his family. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Richard Dreyfuss, Julie Hagerty and Charlie Korsmo.(n)

programme.title: Two Night Stand
programme.desc: A woman recovering from a recent break-up has a one-night stand with a stranger she met online. Hoping to leave quietly in the morning, she instead discovers a blizzard has left them both trapped in his apartment, forcing them to spend an awkward but enlightening day together. Romantic comedy, starring Analeigh Tipton and Miles Teller.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: A male nurse delays proposing to his girlfriend until he has won the approval of her strict father, a former CIA agent who does not suffer fools gladly, and vows to be on his best behaviour during a visit to her family home. However, his efforts to impress soon collapse into a catalogue of disasters. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller, Teri Polo, Blythe Danner and Owen Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Ted 2: Extended Edition
programme.desc: The foul-mouthed talking teddy bear is horrified to discover that he counts as property according to the law. He and his human best friend hire a pot-smoking lawyer to help them fight a court case and get Ted legally recognised as a person. Comedy sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg and Amanda Seyfried, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: A male nurse delays proposing to his girlfriend until he has won the approval of her strict father, a former CIA agent who does not suffer fools gladly, and vows to be on his best behaviour during a visit to her family home. However, his efforts to impress soon collapse into a catalogue of disasters. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller, Teri Polo, Blythe Danner and Owen Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Ted 2: Extended Edition
programme.desc: The foul-mouthed talking teddy bear is horrified to discover that he counts as property according to the law. He and his human best friend hire a pot-smoking lawyer to help them fight a court case and get Ted legally recognised as a person. Comedy sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg and Amanda Seyfried, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: Bachelor Party
programme.desc: A bus driver's forthcoming wedding is jeopardised by his fiancee's hostile parents and a raunchy stag night organised by well-meaning friends. Comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Adrian Zmed, William Tepper and Tawny Kitaen.(n)

programme.title: Gremlins
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday.(n)

programme.title: The Apartment
programme.desc: A lowly insurance clerk tries to curry favour with his seedy manager by lending him his flat for his extramarital flings. But the clerk soon grows wise to the nastiness of corporate ethics and infidelity when his heartless boss seduces the elevator girl, whom he has always loved from afar. Oscar-winning comedy drama, directed by Billy Wilder and starring Jack Lemmon, Fred MacMurray and Shirley MacLaine.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Me
programme.desc: A mentally unstable woman whose life revolves entirely around daytime TV wins the lottery. She immediately stops taking her medication and pays a television studio millions to let her broadcast a show sharing her outlandish views and troubled past with the world. Comedy, Kristen Kirsten Wiig and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally
programme.desc: A man and a woman with different attitudes to life meet by chance and develop a close and long-lasting friendship. But over time, a mutual sexual attraction begins to develop and threatens to ruin their relationship - raising the question whether men and women can ever really be just friends. Romantic comedy, starring Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Casual Encounters
programme.desc: A man who has been unceremoniously dumped by his girlfriend is persuaded by his friends to join a dating website and has a series of disastrous romantic encounters. He realises that he is actually in love with a work colleague - but by this point, he has acquired a string of embarrassing experiences that could jeopardise any hope he has with her. Comedy, starring Taran Killam and Brooklyn Decker.(n)

programme.title: Hitch
programme.desc: A professional relationship guru, who specialises in offering advice to lonely single men, helps an unlucky-in-love accountant to woo the girl of his dreams. However, when he finds himself falling for a beautiful gossip columnist, his usual charm abandons him and he discovers his expertise counts for nothing. Romantic comedy, with Will Smith, Eva Mendes, Kevin James, Amber Valletta, Julie Ann Emery, Adam Arkin and Michael Rapaport.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: Lively teenager Bianca is not allowed to start dating until her man-hating sister Kat does first - but no boy is brave enough to ask her out. However, Bianca's would-be boyfriend thinks he has found the perfect man for the job in the shape of a quirky loner with a mysterious past. Comedy, based on Shakespeare's The Taming of the Shrew, starring Heath Ledger, Julia Stiles, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Larisa Oleynik.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: Hot Pursuit
programme.desc: An uptight, accident prone police officer desperate to prove herself has to protect a gangster's widow who has agreed to give evidence against a drug lord. They end up forced to go on the run together, and are pursued across Texas by hitmen and corrupt cops. Crime comedy, starring Reese Witherspoon and Sofia Vergara.(n)

programme.title: The Bad Education Movie
programme.desc: Incompetent teacher Alfie Wickers decides his students deserve a treat for somehow passing their GCSEs, so decides to take them on the greatest school trip of their lives - to Cornwall. However, a series of disasters leaves the class into trouble with suspicious locals. Comedy, starring Jack Whitehall, Harry Enfield and Iain Glen.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Family man Rusty Griswold spent his childhood family holidays stumbling from one disaster to another with his hapless father. He is determined that his own road trip with his wife and kids will go better - but soon finds the apple has not fallen far from the tree. Sequel to the 1980s comedy series, starring Ed Helms and Christina Applegate, with Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo reprising their roles.(n)

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A lonely student finds her first year at university in New York a disappointing experience, with uninspiring studies and no social life. Everything changes when her mother remarries and she acquires a new stepsister, whose bizarre schemes draw her into the kind of lifestyle she had always dreamed of - and provide fresh creative inspiration. Comedy, starring Lola Kirke and Greta Gerwig.(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Pete's Dragon
programme.desc: A young boy orphaned by a car crash and left alone in a forest befriends a giant, fire-breathing dragon. Fantasy adventure, starring Bryce Dallas Howard, Robert Redford and Oakes Fegley.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)
