programme.title: Don't Breathe
programme.desc: Three teenagers plan to burglarise the home of a wealthy blind man, but their heist quickly goes awry as they end up fighting for their lives(n)

programme.title: Spartacus
programme.desc: Men of Honor. While Spartacus considers striking a deal with a group of marauders, Crassus's son Tiberius makes a bold and fateful decision(n)

programme.title: Spartacus
programme.desc: Decimation. Tension mounts when a Roman spy is suspected of infiltrating Spartacus' army, while Crassus resorts to meting out a long-abandoned form of Roman punishment in order to teach his troops a painful lesson(n)

programme.title: American Gods
programme.desc: The Bone Orchard. Mythological gods muster forces to prepare for war with modern-day deities. In the Series Premiere, Shadow Moon gets early release from prison and meets Mr. Wednesday, who recruites him to be his bodyguard(n)

programme.title: Testament of Youth
programme.desc: Free-spirited Vera Brittain overcomes adversity too win a scholarship to Oxford. While there, she falls in love with Roland Leighton and they begin to pursue their dreams together. But, the onset of World War I rips them apart, and Vera learns first hand the horrors and atrocities of war(n)

programme.title: Dr. Lucille
programme.desc: The story of Lucille Teasdale, one of the first women surgeons in Canada, and her struggle to gain a foothold in the male-dominated world of medicine. It follows her life as a surgeon in Uganda(n)

programme.title: The Mermaid
programme.desc: Shan, who is actually a mermaid, enters the human world in disguise. While there, she meets and falls in love with a real estate developer(n)

programme.title: Hoop Dreams
programme.desc: Steve James' multi-award winning documentary follows two kids from the Chicago projects who, because of their basketball skills, gain a scholarship to a smart high school. James follows them for four years - one makes the cut, the other doesn't but their lives still intertwine in this simple but unforgettably powerful film(n)

programme.title: The Patience Stone
programme.desc: A woman living in a war-torn country confides her fears to her paralyzed husband after he is abandoned by his family and fellow soldiers. In time, her confessions transform her wounded spouse into a magical amulet that shields her from suffering(n)

programme.title: The Visitor
programme.desc: A lonesome widower and college economics professor finds his mundane existence suddenly shaken up when he befriends a pair of illegal immigrants, one of whom has recently been threatened with deportation by U.S. immigration authorities, in the sophomore feature from The Station Agent director Tom McCarthy. Years after losing his wife, 62-year-old Walter Vale (Richard Jenkins) has also lost his passion for writing and teaching. In an effort to fill the empty void that his life has become, Walter makes a half-hearted attempt to learn to play classical piano. Later, when Walter's college sends him to a conference in Manhattan, he is surprised to discover that a young couple has moved into his seldom-used apartment in the city. Tarek (Haaz Sleiman) and his Senegalese girlfriend Zainab (Danai Gurira) have fallen victims to an elaborate real-estate scam, and as a result they no longer have a place to call home. When Walter reluctantly allows the couple to remain in his apartment, talented musician Tarek insists on repaying his host's kindness by teaching him to play the African drum. Over the course of Walter's lessons, the ageing academic finds his spirits revitalized while gaining a newfound appreciation for New York jazz clubs and Central Park drum circles. Later, Tarek is arrested in the subway and threatened with deportation after police learn that he is an undocumented citizen. Suddenly, in his attempt to help his new friend, Walter's passion for life is unexpectedly awakened. When Tarek's radiant mother Mouna (Hiam Abbass) arrives in the city in search of her son, that passion turns to romance -- something that Walter had previously thought he would never experience again(n)

programme.title: Testament of Youth
programme.desc: Free-spirited Vera Brittain overcomes adversity too win a scholarship to Oxford. While there, she falls in love with Roland Leighton and they begin to pursue their dreams together. But, the onset of World War I rips them apart, and Vera learns first hand the horrors and atrocities of war(n)

programme.title: The Mermaid
programme.desc: Shan, who is actually a mermaid, enters the human world in disguise. While there, she meets and falls in love with a real estate developer(n)

programme.title: Tamara Drewe
programme.desc: Stephen Frears directed this comedy drama about an ugly duckling who's followed by a handful of suitors after maturing into a sexy swan. Tamara Drewe (Gemma Arterton) was born and raised in Ewedown, a quiet community on the outskirts of London dominated by a writer's colony run by Nicholas Hardiment (Roger Allam), a best-selling novelist who specializes in crime fiction, and his wife Beth (Tamsin Greig). When Tamara left Ewedown, she was a plain and awkward teenager, but when she returns home for the first time in years, the locals are surprised to discover that time (and a nose job) have turned her into an attractive and alluring woman, and she's gained a share of money and fame thanks to a successful newspaper column. Tamara has returned to Ewedown after the death of her mother in order to refurbish the family home and put it on the market. Before long, Tamara finds herself pursued by three men from her past -- Andy Cobb (Luke Evans), her former boyfriend who has been hired to help fix up the house; Ben Sergeant (Dominic Cooper), the swaggering drummer with a local indie rock band flirting with larger success; and Nicholas (Roger Allam), who is chronically unfaithful to his wife and sees an opportunity with the neighborhood girl who was infatuated with him in her teens. Tamara Drewe was adapted from the graphic novel of the same name by Posy Simmonds, which was in turn inspired by Thomas Hardy's novel Far From the Madding Crowd(n)

programme.title: The Bronze
programme.desc: Once a beloved celebrity who won an Olympic bronze medal in gymnastics while performing with a ruptured Achilles, Hope Ann Greggory (Melissa Rauch) is now a washed-up has-been relying on her past fame to get by. However, opportunity knocks when she is offered the chance to train a promising teenage tumbler (Haley Lu Richardson) in exchange for a financial windfall. Greggory is soon torn between the money and her desire to remain the most famous person in her hometown. Gary Cole, Thomas Middleditch, Sebastian Stan, and Cecily Strong co-star. Directed by Bryan Buckley(n)

programme.title: No Pay, Nudity
programme.desc: A struggling, aging actor must overcome personal and professional strife as he tries to make it and land a career breakthrough(n)

programme.title: The Visitor
programme.desc: A lonesome widower and college economics professor finds his mundane existence suddenly shaken up when he befriends a pair of illegal immigrants, one of whom has recently been threatened with deportation by U.S. immigration authorities, in the sophomore feature from The Station Agent director Tom McCarthy. Years after losing his wife, 62-year-old Walter Vale (Richard Jenkins) has also lost his passion for writing and teaching. In an effort to fill the empty void that his life has become, Walter makes a half-hearted attempt to learn to play classical piano. Later, when Walter's college sends him to a conference in Manhattan, he is surprised to discover that a young couple has moved into his seldom-used apartment in the city. Tarek (Haaz Sleiman) and his Senegalese girlfriend Zainab (Danai Gurira) have fallen victims to an elaborate real-estate scam, and as a result they no longer have a place to call home. When Walter reluctantly allows the couple to remain in his apartment, talented musician Tarek insists on repaying his host's kindness by teaching him to play the African drum. Over the course of Walter's lessons, the ageing academic finds his spirits revitalized while gaining a newfound appreciation for New York jazz clubs and Central Park drum circles. Later, Tarek is arrested in the subway and threatened with deportation after police learn that he is an undocumented citizen. Suddenly, in his attempt to help his new friend, Walter's passion for life is unexpectedly awakened. When Tarek's radiant mother Mouna (Hiam Abbass) arrives in the city in search of her son, that passion turns to romance -- something that Walter had previously thought he would never experience again(n)

programme.title: In Her Shoes
programme.desc: After sleeping with her sister's boyfriend, wild child Maggie goes looking for her long-lost grandma. Can Ella help Maggie change her life and make it up to her big sister Rose? Touching comedy drama based on Jennifer Weiner's bestselling book(n)

programme.title: Edge of Winter
programme.desc: A divorced man tries to reconnect with his two sons during a hunting trip in the wilderness, but the brothers realise that they might not be able to trust their father when a fierce snowstorm strands all of them in a deserted cabin(n)

programme.title: Dark Horse
programme.desc: The residents of a small Welsh village pool their money together to purchase a racehorse, hoping to compete it against the most expensive thoroughbreds in the United Kingdom(n)

programme.title: Paper Heart
programme.desc: Real-life sweethearts Michael Cera and Charlyne Yi star in a fictionalized version of their romance in this indie semi-documentary comedy, written by Yi. Playing themselves, Yi and Cera embark on a scripted version of their own story. In the movie, Yi has agreed to be the subject of a documentary about her quest to discover if love really exists, since she's never experienced it. As part of her participation in the project, she has a film crew follow her around throughout every new development in her love life -- which gets complicated when she starts dating fellow comedian Cera. This portion of the film is all narrative, and was written into the script, but also as part of the documentary, Yi travels the country interviewing various people about their opinions and experiences with love, and these portions of the film are real -- the interviewees are not actors. Melding truth and fantasy, Paper Heart uses equal parts comedy and realism to resolve the ultimate question of whether love is fact or fiction(n)

programme.title: To Rome With Love
programme.desc: In this poignant, hilarious ensemble film, locals and tourists in Rome find their lives intersecting. An architect tries to recapture his youth; an ordinary guy unexpectedly becomes famous; a couple are torn apart by new love interests; an opera director tries to get a mortician to sing on stage(n)

programme.title: Friends With Money
programme.desc: As she reaches her mid-thirties, singleton Olivia begins to envy the security of her richer friends. But although their lives may seem easier, Olivia's friends have their problems too: screenwriters Christine and Patrick are unable to collaborate on their latest project, Jane and Aaron have lost the romance in their relationship and Franny and Matt have difficulties handling the demands of parenthood(n)

programme.title: Boys Don't Cry
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this drama was adapted from the life of Brandon Teena, born Teena Brandon, a woman who chose to live her life as a man and suffered tragic consequences as a result. In 1993, 20-year-old Brandon (Hilary Swank) leaves Lincoln, Nebraska for the nearby community of Falls City, where she sports a crew cut, favors jeans and boots, and is regarded as a man by most of the people in town. While Brandon's friend Lonny (Matt McGrath) warns her that sexual outsiders aren't looked upon kindly in Falls City, she develops a reputation for being something of a ladies' man, and is soon living with a single mother named Candace (Alicia Goranson). But when Brandon meets teenage Lana (Chloe Sevigny), the two become romantically involved almost immediately. Brandon makes friends with Lana's mother (Jeanetta Arnette) and a burly ex-con named John (Peter Sarsgaard). John and his buddy Tom (Brendan Sexton) run with a rough group of men who like to drink and carouse, and they accept Brandon as one of their own. However, when Brandon ends up in jail on a traffic violation, her secret comes out, and, while Lana stands by Brandon's side, John and Tom feel betrayed -- and their anger soon boils over into violence. A distinguished feature debut for director Kimberly Peirce, Boys Don't Cry was enthusiastically received in its showings at 1999 film festivals in Venice, Toronto, and New York(n)

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Burgundy. Lizzie endures a difficult labor while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Later, she discovers she and her husband have more in common than she imagined(n)

programme.title: Coming Home
programme.desc: A Chinese couple are betrayed by their daughter and sent to separate labor camps during the Cultural Revolution. When the husband (Li Gong) is released years later, he discovers that his wife (Gong Li) has amnesia and doesn't remember him(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An idealistic FBI agent (Daniel Radcliffe) goes deep undercover within a white-supremacy group in order to bring down the organization from the inside. Daniel Ragussis directed this crime thriller, which co-stars Toni Collette and Tracy Letts(n)

programme.title: Where Do We Go Now?
programme.desc: In this comedy-drama, the women of a small village in Lebanon cook up a number of wacky schemes and ruses in the hopes of preventing the local men from starting a religious war(n)

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Burgundy. Lizzie endures a difficult labor while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Later, she discovers she and her husband have more in common than she imagined(n)

programme.title: Elizabeth
programme.desc: Cate Blanchett received an Oscar nomination for her portrayal of Britain's first woman monarch in Shekhar Kapur's award winning FilmFour Production. Elizabeth traces the early years of the Queen, from her battle for the throne against Mary Queen Of Scots (Kathy Burke) for the throne through the political and emotional intrigues to her seizure of absolute power as the Virgin Queen, answerable to no man(n)

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Burgundy. Lizzie endures a difficult labor while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Later, she discovers she and her husband have more in common than she imagined(n)

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: A gay lawyer with AIDS fights for his rights after being fired from his law firm(n)

programme.title: Sorority Boys
programme.desc: Three rowdy college students are kicked out of their dorm and dress up in drag to live in the DOG house, where the girls deemed unattractive live(n)

programme.title: Tank Girl
programme.desc: Futuristic adventure about a post-apocalyptic heroine who faces up to an evil business magnate who is withholding water from the population. Aided by an army of half-man, half-kangaroo rebels, the fearless Tank Girl is the only one capable of challenging the fiend. Can she use her powers of charm, impudence and sexuality - and her tank - to defeat him? ((n)

programme.title: 40 Days and 40 Nights
programme.desc: Comedy about a young man who decides to abstain from all sexual contact following the bitter break-up of his most recent relationship. But during his period of self-imposed celibacy, he meets the girl of his dreams(n)

programme.desc: A lazy stoner is the sole witness to a murder by an evil drug lord and a corrupt cop. Marked for death, he runs for his life, dragging his dazed dealer and his supplier with him on a hilarious pot-fueled adventure(n)

programme.title: The Kids Are All Right
programme.desc: The biological father of a lesbian couple's two teen children enters their lives after the son expresses a desire to find him, and the sperm donor's easygoing demeanor has a profound effect on the family(n)

programme.title: Undrafted
programme.desc: A college baseball star is unexpectedly passed over during the MLB draft. Later, a meaningless game with his offbeat intramural pals turns into a pivotal, cathartic moment for him as he struggles to overcome his disappointment(n)

programme.title: Fever Pitch
programme.desc: Ben (Jimmy Fallon) must choose between his love for Lindsey (Drew Barrymore) and the baseball team he supports, the Boston Red Sox. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch and released in America under that title, the two leads bring the same warmth and humour to their roles as their British counterparts. Even sports fans unfamiliar with baseball will know the pain that comes from attending an important function when your team are playing a crucial match(n)

programme.desc: Epic historical drama documenting a legal battle over a shipload of slaves who overpowered their captors at sea and landed on the shores of America. Initially, the argument in the courts revolves around the issue of property and ownership. Gradually though, the lawyers for the defence come to understand and appreciate the humanity of the men turned into cargo by the evils of slavery(n)

programme.desc: The rise of Leonard Chess' Chess Records and its recording artists including Muddy Waters, Little Walter, Chuck Berry, Willie Dixon and the great Etta James(n)

programme.title: Six Degrees of Separation
programme.desc: A well-to-do couple are duped by a young but shrewd con artist who palms himself off on New York socialites as the son of Sydney Poitier(n)

programme.desc: Frenetic holiday fare about an absentminded father who frantically tries to find a popular toy on Christmas Eve. Sinbad. The cast features former "SNL" regulars Phil Hartman, James Belushi and Laraine Newman(n)

programme.title: College Road Trip
programme.desc: A high-school student (Raven Symone) with noble dreams of becoming a public defender sets out to visit potential universities in the unwanted company of her father (Martin Lawrence) -- an overprotective cop -- in this road trip comedy produced by Andrew Gunn and directed by Roger Kumble. Melanie (Symone) is about to graduate high school, and she's ready to take her first step toward adulthood by hitting the road to explore her college prospects with a few close female friends. But despite the fact that this trip is strictly "girls only," Melanie's father isn't comfortable with the prospect of his little princess hitting the road without an adult chaperone -- and what better guardian to have while you're out on the open road than the chief of police himself? Of course, while Melanie's father only has the best of intentions, his presence on a trip that was designed to mark his little girl's emergence as a young adult leads to an endless series of comic complications(n)

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: Frenetic holiday fare about an absentminded father who frantically tries to find a popular toy on Christmas Eve. Sinbad. The cast features former "SNL" regulars Phil Hartman, James Belushi and Laraine Newman(n)

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: A couple who are called away from home reluctantly choose their children's unreliable Uncle Buck to babysit for three weeks(n)

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: Don Bluth and Gary Goldman's animated drama is loosely based on the story of Anastasia, grand-daughter of the last Tsar of Russia. When the family is killed, only Anastasia and her grandmother escape, but they are separated. Years later, conmen Dimitri and Vladimir hear of a reward for the return of Anastasia to her grandmother and begin preparing Anya to play the part, little realising that the teenage girl is, in fact, the real Anastasia. With Christopher Lloyd as the voice of Rasputin who, trapped in limbo, can only escape if his curse is fulfilled and the Tsar's bloodline is finally ended(n)

programme.desc: When a tiny girl named Arrietty (voice of Bridgit Mendler) befriends a normal-size 12-year-old boy, the pair must find a way to keep the existence of Arrietty's family of little people a secret in this exciting animated adaptation of "The Borrowers."(n)

programme.title: Franny's Feet
programme.desc: Mischievous Magpies; Snowy Jamaica. Franny meets two magpies and gets them to stop squabbling; in Jamaica, she meets an old friend who has never seen snow(n)

programme.desc: Creature That Could Change Colour; Where's Spike; Baby Bird and His Nest. Connie and friends search for a creature that can change color(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther
programme.desc: The world's most inept detective returns to the screen in this modern slapstick comedy. France's come-from-behind victory in the World Cup soccer championships turns tragic when the team's coach, Yves Gulant (Jason Statham), is murdered during a post-game celebration. Gulant's girlfriend, pop star Xania (Beyoncé Knowles), was standing by his side as he was felled by a poisoned dart, and in the chaos that followed a diamond ring he gave her was stolen, which held one of the world's largest and most valuable jewels, known as "the Pink Panther." The media and the public demand that the killer be found out and brought to justice, and Chief Inspector Dreyfus (Kevin Kline) of the Paris Police pledges to put his best man on the case. However, somehow the astoundingly clumsy but consistently lucky Inspector Jacques Clouseau (Steve Martin) gets the assignment instead, and with his assistant, Gendarme Gilbert Ponton (Jean Reno), in tow, Clouseau follows a dizzying trail of clues from Paris to New York City as he attempts to recover the rare diamond and find the villains who killed Gulant. An updated variant on the Inspector Clouseau comedies that helped make Peter Sellers a major star in the United States, The Pink Panther also stars Emily Mortimer, Kristin Chenoweth, Roger Rees, and William Abadie; leading man Steve Martin also wrote the film's screenplay(n)

programme.title: Dragonslayer
programme.desc: In the dark ages, magic was a weapon. Adventure was everywhere, and heroes were needed to fight those mythical beasts, the dragons. One of these heroes was a young sorcerer's apprentice, whose challenge was to slay a dragon that had a whole kingdom in its grip. To him it sounded like a great adventure, until he met the fearsome beast. But with courage, magic, and the love of a beautiful maiden to help him, the youngster fought against the odds to kill his fiery foe(n)

programme.title: El lado oscuro de la justicia
El lado oscuro de la justicia
We Are Still Here
programme.desc: A grieving couple who recently lost their son move to a New England town, where they are soon haunted by vengeful spirits looking for a sacrifice(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: The New Exhibit. First telecast April 4, 1963, this grim 60-minute Twilight Zone installment would seem to be more suited to Alfred Hitchcock Presents or Thriller. Martin Balsam stars as Martin Senescu, curator of a "chamber of horrors" wax museum. Upon learning that the museum is to be demolished, Martin takes his favorite wax statues -- those of Jack the Ripper, Henri "Bluebeard" Landru, and ax murderer Albert W. Hicks -- to his home, much to the dismay of his wife Emma (Maggie Mahoney). Not long afterward, two brutal murders take place -- and the evidence leads Martin to conclude that the culprits were his beloved wax figures. Though credited to Charles Beaumont, "The New Exhibit" was actually scripted by longtime Beaumont collaborator Jerry Sohl(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: The Mirror. This sledgehammer attack on Cuban dictator Fidel Castro stars Peter Falk as bearded banana-republic revolutionary Ramos Clemente. Upon taking control of the government, Clemente summons forth the man he has deposed, General DeCruz (Will Kuluva). Gloating, Clemente asks DeCruz if he has anything to say before he is executed. With a sly smile, DeCruz directs Clemente's attention to a huge mirror in the presidential palace, informing Clemente that the mirror will reveal the faces of those who will ultimately destroy him. He's right, of course, and any viewer who can't see the ending coming a mile away deserves to be drummed out of the living room in disgrace. Written by Rod Serling, "The Mirror" was originally telecast October 26, 1961(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: The Self-improvement of Salvadore Ross. Don Gordon stars as Salvatore Ross, a repulsively arrogant young man who thinks that the world owes him a living. When he is rejected by virtuous social worker Leah Maitland (Gail Kobe), Ross vows to improve himself, and to do that he harnesses his newly-found ability to acquire the physical and personal traits of other people. But Ross miscalculates when he tries out his special skills on Leah's saintly father (Vaughn Taylor). The supporting cast of this Twilight Zone entry ran the age gamut from 20-something Seymour Cassel to septuagenarian Douglas Dumbrille. Scripted by Jerry McNeeley (of The Man from U.N.C.L.E. fame) from a story by Henry Slesar, "The Self-Improvement of Salvatore Ross" made its network bow on January 17, 1964(n)

programme.title: Goblin
programme.desc: On every Halloween the small town of Hollow Glen is haunted by a Goblin who sets out to kill every infant it can find. This follows a harmless ritual in 1831, where the farmers made a bonfire out of diseased crops to bless next year's harvest. During the ritual a couple threw their sickly, deformed child in to the fire and out of the ashes rose the gobbling that has haunted the town ever since(n)

programme.title: Scream of the Banshee
programme.desc: In this unrelenting tale of terror, a murderous monster is unleashed after archaeology professor Isla Whelan (Lauren Holly) and her students unearth an antique box and free the bloodthirsty banshee inside. Before long, they begin to perish under mysterious circumstances(n)

programme.title: My Soul to Take
programme.desc: When Abel Plenkov, The Riverton Ripper, dies while being arrested, his multiple personalities are transferred to the souls of seven children who were born prematurely that same night. Sixteen years later, the Ripper returns to stalk them. After five of his friends are killed on their collective birthday, 16-year-old Bug realises that he is the victim of a terrible curse. (HD)(n)

programme.title: Skyfall
programme.desc: James Bond returns to hunt a mysterious enemy that threatens to bring down MI6. After dropping seemingly to his death on a failed mission, Bond's presumed demise leaves the job of boss M on the line. Back in London, her post is scrutinised further when a bomb decimates the MI6 building, forcing their operation underground. Chilling villain Raoul Silva claims responsibility, before holding M to ransom with stolen top secret information. Bond is desperately needed, so when he reappears from the dead, M ensures he's thrust straight back into action. As he goes gunning for Silva, can the jaded agent rediscover his lust for the job and save Queen, country and M once again?(n)

programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: The Chinese Restaurant. This episode from the second season is considered by many fans to be the epitome of the series' "show about nothing" concept. The entire episode takes place in a Chinese restaurant while Jerry, Elaine, and George wait a ridiculous amount of time for a table. Between daring each other to do embarrassing things to pass the time, Elaine begins to lose her wits out of hunger, Jerry can't remember the name of a woman he runs into, and George fights over a pay phone on which he is awaiting a call. James Hong and David Tress guest star. Originally airing May 23, 1991, "The Chinese Restaurant" was the sixth episode taped for the second season, despite being aired 11th(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: And the Temporary Distraction. Now that their cupcake shop has closed, Caroline and Max take temporary office jobs to make ends meet. Despite lessons from Max in how to operate effectively as a temp without doing too much work, Caroline is soon excelling at the job and making a good impression. However, when Caroline is offered a full-time position at the firm, and manages to get Max permanent employment too, the girls must make a big decision about what their future holds(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: 'Til Death Do Us Part. Peg (Katey Sagal) tells Marcy (Amanda Bearse) in STRICTEST CONFIDENCE that Al (Ed O'Neill) isn't so hot in bed. Evidently misconstruing the concept of STRICTEST CONFIDENCE, Marcy proceeds to relay this news to everyone in the neighborhood and the outlying suburbs. Embarrassed, Al vows to get back into tip-top shape for his next boudoir appointment. This episode affords the viewer the first horrifying glimpse of the Bundy basement--not to mention some really "bad hair."(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Wedding Repercussions. In this sequel to the earlier episode The Wedding Show, the Bundys' cousin Jimmy (a young Abraham Benrubi) finds out that someone else slept with his wife Janie on their wedding day. In desperation, Jimmy appeals to Bud (David Faustino) to help him find the guilty party--little suspecting that Bud himself is the very guy he seeks. This episode offers yet another variation on the Bundy Family Credo: "Lie, Sell Shoes, and Lie"(n)

programme.desc: The One with Phoebe's Husband. Is Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) so desperate for a husband that she's willing to marry a gay Canadian ice skater? Not exactly: It seems that Phoebe's new hubby, a guy named Duncan (Steve Zahn), needs an American wife so that he can get a green card and stay in the country. In another affair of the heart, Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) comes to the "rescue" of Ross (David Schwimmer) in his efforts to show Julie (Lauren Tom) the breadth and depth of his love(n)

programme.sub-title: The One with the Baby on the Bus
programme.desc: The One with the Baby on the Bus. This episode was a crossover with the NBC sitcom Caroline in the City, hence the surprise guest star. The important plot points: Ross' son, Ben, is "misplaced" on a bus by the errant Chandler (Matthew Perry) and Joey (Matt LeBlanc). Ross (David Schwimmer) has a disturbing reaction to Monica's (Courteney Cox) kiwi-lime pie. And Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) doesn't get to sing at the Central Perk tonight -- but she does get to perform anyway. The DVD version of this episode includes material not seen in the syndicated version(n)

programme.title: Trail of the Yukon
programme.desc: Father and son bank robbers flee into the wilderness by canoe after their partners in crime turn on them. They are pursued by a mountie and his faithful dog, who begins to suspect that the bank's owner may have cheated the fugitives out of their rightful property, forcing them to turn to crime. Western, starring Kirby Grant and Suzanne Dalbert.(n)

programme.title: Badman's Country
programme.desc: Famous sheriff Pat Garrett joins forces with his fellow lawmen Wyatt Earp, Bat Masterson and Buffalo Bill to bring Butch Cassidy's gang of outlaws to justice and protect a frontier town. However, the residents soon begin to fear that having them around will only cause more trouble. Western, starring George Montgomery, Neville Brand and Buster Crabbe.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke in Tucson
programme.desc: A boy who witnessed his father's murder grows up to be a hardened criminal, and his own brother is forced to bring him to justice. After his release from prison, he becomes a lawman and tries to stop a corrupt rancher seizing control of his neighbours' valuable land - but to do so, he needs the help of his old partners-in-crime. Western, starring Mark Stevens and Forrest Tucker.(n)

programme.title: The Big Trees
programme.desc: An unscrupulous timber baron is determined to get his hands on some land heavily forested with redwoods and owned by a small Quaker community. However, he has a change of heart when he falls in love with one of the Quaker women, and has to contend with other less principled rivals who are also after the land. Romantic drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Eve Miller, Edgar Buchanan and Patrice Wymore.(n)

programme.title: How the West Was Won
programme.desc: Three generations of a pioneering family experience many ordeals and adventures in their endeavour to build a new life for themselves on the American frontier in the 19th century. Over the years, the family experiences the key events of the nation's history, including the gold rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads. Epic Western, starring James Stewart, John Wayne, Gregory Peck, Henry Fonda, Debbie Reynolds, Lee J Cobb and Richard Widmark.(n)

programme.title: High Noon
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef.(n)

programme.title: The Naked Spur
programme.desc: An embittered bounty hunter spends weeks on the trail of an elusive outlaw in the hope of claiming the $5,000 reward on his head. However, he makes the mistake of enlisting two dubious acquaintances to help him - an error of judgement that threatens to cost him more than just the money. Anthony Mann's Western, starring James Stewart, Robert Ryan, Ralph Meeker, Millard Mitchell and Janet Leigh.(n)

programme.title: Big Jake
programme.desc: Bandits attack a Texas ranch and kidnap a boy, demanding a $1million ransom. However, they have reckoned without the intervention of the youngster's tough grandfather, who sets out on the trail with the aid of his two sons, a cunning tracker and his faithful dog. Western, starring John Wayne, Richard Boone, Maureen O'Hara, Chris Mitchum and Patrick Wayne.(n)

programme.title: Zoolander

Comedy, starring Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson, Will Ferrell, Milla Jovovich, Christine Taylor and David Duchovny.(n)

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: A power-crazed bully, a sleazy cocaine addict and a sexual predator each make an employee's life a misery, but the three workers cannot afford to quit their jobs. They resort to desperate measures by conspiring to murder each other's bosses, with a little help from an eccentric ex-convict. Comedy, starring Jason Bateman, Charlie Day, Jason Sudeikis, Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Aniston and Colin Farrell.(n)

Drama, with Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Claude Rains and Paul Henreid.(n)
